When I got there she handed me a bag that had his cane (I don’t think he ever used a cane- I also couldn’t help thinking that he must have a lot of energy tied to his cane since he must’ve used it all the time) and like a red stuffed primitive star decoration. In a previous dream from a few nights ago I remember being at this same apartment except in this one it wasn’t my Pap’s, and I cleaned underneath the fridge and found a red stuffed star primitive magnet- just like the one my sister just gave me although hers wasn’t a magnet. I cleaned it off and put it into a basket of stuff for my sister. Now in the dream of this apartment being my Pap’s I give my sister the basket with the primitive star magnet in it and everything. Then I remember crying, a lot like drowning my face with tears, because of how much I miss my pap and how much it meant to have some of his items even if it was just a cane and some little stuffed thing.

So I dreamed that I was at my sons school and it felt so real…. As I was looking for my car with my unborn baby in my arms I look up and see it and see my dead grandmother and currently alive uncle but he looked dead both looked like corpses on the backseat I freaked out and look down and my baby disappears I ran to the car and the baby is in there moving around so I get in the car and try to get home but it leads me towards my old road to my grandmothers house across the state I pumped the breaks and do a u turn and try to get back home but more roads keep appearing and I panic and end up crashing the car so I get my stroller and baby and start walking but the closer I get to a building the farther away it goes and I can’t make it and I woke up what does it mean I felt like I kept trying to get home but it kept pulling me back to my old house
comment_text: Isabel Gasca I would interpret this as an unresolved issue from your past that is keeping you from moving forward. It may have to do with family. You want to move forward and create your new life but this has to be dealt with first.

post_text: I was together with a group of settlers. We were me, a warrior and a few others who weren't warriors. We needed to build a place to live in the wild. We found a hillside with grass that seemed good. We started collecting things and I followed the warriors lead. There came some attacking us, two of them were gnomes/dwarves. I managed to keep them at a distance with my knife but given the opportunity I didn't manage to hurt them. I just drew the knife alongside the gnome's cheek and there came a little blood. I really tried to become more ruthless but it was hard. We captured them. I saw so many baby shoes on the ground that I needed to gather up. There were so many. And then I went to collect food and wood.
comment_text:
Hello, what an interesting dream!

I feel this dream is a call for you to come into yoyr power.

The warrior is an archetypal figure that many of us dream of. He is the hero found in many stories. Brave, bold and confident. Able to tackle life's challenges and push through against all obstacles and opponents. He fights for truth, he stands against all that is "bad" in this world and stands up proudly for what he beleives is right.

The dream calls you to be the warrior in yoyr own life.

Living in the wild is about finding yoyr own sense of authenticity. To be who you are in your most natural state. Being unafraid and unashamed in your own sense of self, that who you are, what you beleive on and how you want to show the that to the world.

As you move into the position of the wild authentic warrior you may come across those who wish to attack you, to see you fail or knock you down. Because they themselves are challenged by your sense of pride and confidence in who you are. They will not want you to change, to move away from their controll or beleive about who you are or who you should be.

The gnomes show that you feel yourself to be "bigger" than them. They are no real threat to you when you stand in yoyr power, but they can cause some trouble so best to keep your distance. I feel you have given these people a taste of yoyr new found strength and confidence, but you do not seek to really hurt them.

" I really tried to become more ruthless but it was hard" I feel this is true of yoyr life right now. It is hard to move away from compliance and move towards agency. You do have to be ruthless, you have to put yourself and your own needs first.

I feel the baby shoes on the ground are a symbol of the immature steps you have taken in life on the road to maturity. Perhaps in the past others have had to clear up after you If you have made any bad decissions etc. Perhaps there is some clearing up for you to do now as you learn to deal with your own affairs. Once you have everything in order you will be better able to meet your own needs.

One idea to consider, others might offer alternative suggestions.

post_text:
Please help me interpret this dream

So i have this fresh milk in the bottle and i got it from someone who claim its good quality. However (and for unknown reason) I've got the sudden feeling that this is not a pure milk but instead, a poisonous one. But even though i had that weird thought, I still bought it from the store because a friend of mine suddenly showed up and i dont want her to question the store's credibility too.

After buying the milk and losing my friend from the mall (since she also have errands to do), i quickly lined up on this another store and asked them to clean the bottle of the milk and scan the beverage for its ingredients or content. Suddenly, this friend of mine also popped up in this store and this time i have the feeling that she's suspicious of the milk's content too. Apparently when the lady that scanned the milk came back, she said that it's 90% milk content so, I quickly reasoned myself out to my friend and said that I just wanted to get the bottle cleaned but deep inside, I still doubt this and thought that I'll just throw it out once im home.

After exiting the mall and while walking down the street, i sensed this one man looking suspiciously at us. I grabbed my friend's hand and pulled her to walk faster and exit these streets but more numbers of men got up and chased us. We continuously ran until we reached this street where another group of men is waiting for us. And this time, I couldn't pull my friend to run anymore, she just stopped and stared at them this time.
comment_text: It seems what you think and do has consequences that you sometimes feel deeply responsible for. You have to conduct yourself in ways that doesn't influence people in wrong ways, so sometimes you try to hide your thoughts and intentions. There are parts of yourself you try to keep pure and preserve their innocence.

post_text: I'm 20w pregnant and the last three nights in my dream I've been able to see babies feet and toes pressed against my tummy. In today's ultrasound appointment he kept showing us his little feet. Thought it was a really cool coincidence.

Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thank you so much!❤️

post_text: Last night I dreamed that I was walking, with difficulty, along a path on a sheer mountain face, I think with someone else. Climbed up on a big, wobbly rock. I tried to make it stop wobbling, but the next thing I know I'm falling backward through space, with no end in sight. I keep having these dreams about falling off a mountain, and of a mountain standing in my way - the same one every time. I'm in kind of a bad way, physically and emotionally. This feels like a warning, to get my act together. What do you guys think?
comment_text:
Richard Johnson I would interpret this as anxiety/
difficulty overcoming an aspiration/
obstacle in your life. That could be anything from relationship to a job to financial, etc. Something thats creating that emotion in waking life
reply_text: Terry Dey Thank you. That sounds right on. I appreciate your input.

post_text: Last night I dreamed that I was walking, with difficulty, along a path on a sheer mountain face, I think with someone else. Climbed up on a big, wobbly rock. I tried to make it stop wobbling, but the next thing I know I'm falling backward through space, with no end in sight. I keep having these dreams about falling off a mountain, and of a mountain standing in my way - the same one every time. I'm in kind of a bad way, physically and emotionally. This feels like a warning, to get my act together. What do you guys think?
comment_text:
The analogy is that you're climbing a slippery slope. It sounds like there is something you want to overcome or a goal you want to reach. But to get there, you have to climb up (work at it) this mountain (obstacle in your way). However, you don't believe you can do it. You think you'll slip, and so you do, every time. And when you do slip, there is no one there to catch you. You fall into a black oblivion, because you don't feel supported in your climb. You feel like you're on your own, and you don't believe you can do it.

I'd use this dream to tell myself to have more trust in myself, and faith in other people. And also, that climbing this mountain is very doable.
reply_text: Annie Dai Great observations and advice. Thank you so much!

post_text: What does it mean to have sexual dreams about a particular someone? Lately, I've dreamt sexually of Kaley Cuoco likely due to having sexual fantasies about her. If there's any other reason that happens, I'm interested to know.
comment_text: Often dreaming of having sex with someone can happen when you have a desire to embody the dominant trait you see in them. Or if it is someone you don't care for in waking life it can be realizing you body a trait you don't care for that you're projecting onto them. Or they could even represent an action or a career for example, if the person is a coach and you are thinking you might enjoy becoming a coach you might have a dream you have sex with someone you know is a coach. But it sounds like your dream is more literal.
reply_text: Lauren Wemmer Not necessarily am I dreaming of having sex with her, but rather I dream of her in my sexual fantasies probably because I've stuck her in those in real life. I don't usually talk about my sexual fantasies with people, but would it help if I described the nature of them in my dreams?

Lauren Wemmer A few months ago, I dreamed up a fictional video of Kaley Cuoco with someone (a guy probably) filming her. She was wearing a fleece hoodie and pleated jean skirt. The filmer told her to imitate an elephant so she sat down and did her best impression of an elephant trumpet. As she was trumpeting, as if through Photoshop, her head became an elephant's. A woman dressed like that in an elephant head is a common fantasy of mine so to see it translated into a dream was... Interesting to say the least.

Just last night, however, I dreamt I was following the same actress through a mall/theme park area. She was wearing her character, Penny's, waitress costume from The Big Bang Theory. I approached to compliment her outfit and she seemed slightly uncomfortable. I then proceeded to try and get a look up her skirt by waiting at the bottom of stairs and eventually saw her white panties. Seeing up a woman's skirt was a much bigger fantasy of mine when I was a teen, but as an adult I would never exhibit such behavior as in this dream.

Whether either of these have meaning outside of being my fantasies, I'm not entirely sure.

post_text: I’ve been having violent nightmares once again. I am a recently born again Christian after finally having enough of this. I’m so beyond tired of this crap. I’ve noticed that after praying, the dreams get worse. Anyways, the dreams are fading, but it was a series of nightmares involving various violent/gruesome/gory events. I don’t want to go into extreme detail because I’d rather not remember, but one involved being in a bad airplane crash and having my body mangled, the other was me being shot down continuously, one was me being stabbed, and so on so forth. The plane crash one kept repeating itself, like the crash kept repeating but in different scenarios. Now, I’ll admit I do watch dark stuff before bed sometimes, I have broken most of this habit but at times get sucked back into it. Whenever I happen to come across something dark like that, I pray heavily before sleeping in order to rid my mind of any dark thoughts. Lastnight it didn’t seem to matter however, since the dreams just kept getting worse and worse. It is so frustrating to be robbed of sleep like this, especially a young person like me who desperately needs the energy that comes with a decent night’s sleep. This is awful and I’m hoping it changes with continuous prayer.

reply_text: Mileni D'Alberti thank you. I think I just concluded that this must be spiritual. I’m at a loss. I can’t find any other valid explanation as to why this suffering has been going on for so long. I used to be really into horror shows/movies but I more or less cut that stuff out entirely within the past while. It doesn’t seem to matter though. I’ll just keep praying.

post_text: I’ve been having violent nightmares once again. I am a recently born again Christian after finally having enough of this. I’m so beyond tired of this crap. I’ve noticed that after praying, the dreams get worse. Anyways, the dreams are fading, but it was a series of nightmares involving various violent/gruesome/gory events. I don’t want to go into extreme detail because I’d rather not remember, but one involved being in a bad airplane crash and having my body mangled, the other was me being shot down continuously, one was me being stabbed, and so on so forth. The plane crash one kept repeating itself, like the crash kept repeating but in different scenarios. Now, I’ll admit I do watch dark stuff before bed sometimes, I have broken most of this habit but at times get sucked back into it. Whenever I happen to come across something dark like that, I pray heavily before sleeping in order to rid my mind of any dark thoughts. Lastnight it didn’t seem to matter however, since the dreams just kept getting worse and worse. It is so frustrating to be robbed of sleep like this, especially a young person like me who desperately needs the energy that comes with a decent night’s sleep. This is awful and I’m hoping it changes with continuous prayer.
comment_text: When you are having nightmares, it is because your subconscious is trying to tell you something. Usually the death of self is an indication of a change in your beliefs. The subconscious is that part of you that is always awake and always in touch with God. For this reason, I think you will be helped if each night in your prayers, you ask for clarification of the message about the nightmares. Do this every night until you get an answer. It shouldn't take long to get the answer.

post_text:
Hi everyone, sorry if I ramble on.... I had a very vivid dream last night.

It starts off with me being in a room and I keep calling people my ex husbands name.
The room that I'm in seems like a hotel room... its covered in a purplish pink velvet, floor to ceiling. I find a mysterious door that I knew had existed but just never found it until now. I open it up and look down, it's endless flights of stairs. The stairs are narrow but covered in the same coloured velvet, I start my decline and every so often I come to a platform thats a jump away from the stairs. It's like a viewing platform that has a door with lights on either side. I didn't want to jump over onto it to see what's behind the door. I continue down and finally the stairs leads me to a door, I open it and it's a room that has a musical instrument in it, I can't quite remember what sort but it was a magical one that would start playing. I walk across the room to the door infront of me and open it and its like I'm back at the beginning, it's more endless flights of stairs. I decend again, to come across another viewing platform that is a jump away from the stairs that has a single door with lights on either side, identical to the last one. And so I continued... over and over.

Thanks for reading
comment_text: Have you been meditating recently? The color would suggest it and seems like you are descending into successively deeper levels of relaxation with potential to access the subconscious.
reply_text: Lauren Wemmer I haven't but I was under a lot of stress yesterday. I had wine to drink, so I'm surprised I was able to remember the dream

post_text: I have a question, do you guys think that all dreams have meaning? Most of my dreams are a jumbled mess, and sometimes reflect what i had recently been watching on tv. The only dreams I've ever really paid attention to are recurring dreams. I feel the recurring dreams have to mean something
comment_text: Personally I think you can find meaning in all dreams if you want to. You can find meaning in anything, if you want to. It's true sometimes themes from tv etc might creep in....But your mind see many many things each day, something in that tv show likley resonates and so the theme is chosen. Those jumbled up dreams can sometimes hold the most information. We dream many times a night and only remember a small portion, I feel we remember the bits that have the most meaning.

post_text:
Spooky.

So this is two separate dreams, 2 days in a row.

Im inside my house and I see masked figures outside slamming into the windows of my house. Over and over again. I was so mad a found a large stick/staff and went outside to find them hiding around the side of my house. It was an inspector I sometimes use (who I get along great with) and a few others I did not recognize. I was very dissatisfied and upset and threatened to hurt them and they left after I shared my distaste.

The next day I was in my living room and noticed water damage coming through all of the walls/ceiling (some context last year we had some water leaks and it left our house cut open for the better part of 8 months waiting for contractors that in itself was a nightmare) as I looked closer at the walls I noticed they almost looked like they were molding or looked very old and cracking with scars on the walls, I looked up to the top left and there was a large, almost demonic alien full head/face imprinted in the wall, like as if the face was inside the wall pushing out. It had a very large cranium and smaller mouth comparable to an alien, this shit was scary looking. To my wife I said wtf is that! I then noticed halloweeny decorations all around the house and at that point I lost it and said babe did you put these decorations up?? She said no. All of a sudden a giant owl flew smacking straight into the window glass with force, I immediately ran outside to find I was in a cul de sac and the owl was hanging in front of the window connected to a long clothes line that was attached to a home across the street.
I was so pissed and as I walk up to the house, the same people from the dream before came out with masks holding swords and approached me, I was able to disarm a sword from one of the three men, this time I didn’t recognize any of them. I realized the swords were wooden, then I remember waking myself up yelling we need to lock the doors.

I’ll never forget that dream 🙃
comment_text: You may be feeling moody, and would like to be left alone. The alien in the wall may be a way of saying you feel alienated. You don’t like it at all.
reply_text: Rita Catherine I totally have been feeling that way

post_text: So I work in a school with kids who have Autism. Last night, I dreamed that one of the students who’s 11 years old and I went on a roller coaster only the seats were more like a chair lift. It took us up, up, up and then when we reached the top, we slid into a house. There was a woman who lived there. She fed us tomato soup for lunch and my student got it all over his shirt. The woman brought him another shirt and said she had a son by the same name who passed away a few years before and she hadn’t been able to get rid of his things. His name was written on the tag of the shirt. My student put on the shirt and we then left to go home. 🤷🏻‍♀️
comment_text:
How you feel about this particular kid is probably important. The roller coaster ride may be the emotions you feel, and the chair lift going up high could be the improvement you see in him. You may be feeling enthusiastic about his progress. Not being able to get rid of his things could mean holding on to something...may
be a belief that he could do it.
If it’s not about him, it’s probably about you.

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for this!

post_text: Okay… that was a weird dream.. I somehow pulled a bone out of my nose. It looked like a thin chicken bone not an actual nose bone. But I was babysitting and I had the kids drive me to the ER and the dr took a knife and and peeled back my skin to put the bone back. I was awake. It was the strangest feeling/ dream I’ve had. After like 10 minutes of the dr digging around to put the bone back up there I woke up bc my conscious was like get me tf out of here lmfao 🤣
comment_text:
Weird dreams are the best, lol. I think your dream could be that you were looking at the "bare bones" of your feelings as nose can equate to intuitive sense. That the bone looked like a chicken bone might be examining your fears more closely. Maybe getting the bone put back in after digging around might be you found your feelings were warranted after you really delved into the matter. That's my guess but there can be many interpretations
that could fit.

comment_text: Your improving your recall. Your dreaming mind is getting ready to perform. Start writing them down.

post_text:
Hi. New to the group. I had a dream that has been bothering me.

Background: I dated someone in 2015. The person broke up with me out of nowhere, when things were going pretty well. Over the phone, mind you.

We were both young and this person wasn’t ready to settle down. This person was perfectly decent and I cared for them a lot, at the time.

I was heartbroken, but I moved on.

This person reached out to me in 2016 to apologize, but I immediately cut them off, and respectfully told them I was doing great, had moved on and wasn’t interested in their apology, friendship or otherwise. I wished them a beautiful life, sincerely and wholeheartedly.

Fast forward to last week. This person comes to me in a dream.

We are in the same place, they wave at me to get my attention.

I tell them “Hi, nice to see you but I can’t talk. I’m late to pick up my kid from daycare.”

They keep saying something I can’t understand, and I’m in a rush and get to my car. I then find the car has been hit / is dented and the tires are flat. This person is gone and I’m stuck there.

*I wake up.*

The next morning, out of curiosity, I type their name on Facebook and after some digging, I find out they died unexpectedly last summer. Young, seemingly healthy person. Poof gone.

Now, I’m here feeling sad and spooked.

Any interpretations? Thank you!
comment_text: In the dream you’re rushing and feeling like it’s too late to stop and listen to what someone has to say to you. In real life you cut him off when he wanted to apologize, so you didn’t listen then either. You need to take more care, slow down and concentrate on what’s important. The flat tires mean you’re going nowhere, you’re feeling stuck.
reply_text: Rita, I don't understand the bit about taking more care. I do regret not hearing him out, but I feel I was perfectly polite in my response. I guess I'll never know. Thank you!

post_text: So recently..reoccurring themes have been brought to me..my tarot cards have said I need to unleash my primal wild side out more..and things that have been blocking my future has gotten me down..and then last night I had a dream about a hugeee alligator..and I was just looking for a way to escape it...my moms side of the family was with me before I entered the room with the alligator, because I just wanted to get away from them.. and the alligator was in the water and I was up looking down on it but I was afraid it was going to raise up and eat me..and I called for help but my mom and her family didn’t help, I reached out to my boyfriend and he opened the door for me..and I feel like recently that’s why my real life has been calling out too..like I just want to get away from my mom..for my own well-being…and so I’ve read alligator dreams..especially big ones is a sign of a warning..so now I’m alittle nervous..anyone have any insight, I allready looked up what to expect and I shouldn’t be too surprised this is all happening right now.
comment_text: The alligator is a symbol of your untamed lower or animal nature. It could have to do with sexuality. Water is emotion and the fear you are experiencing is because you haven't consciously faced your fear. I suggest asking to face your fear as you are going to sleep each night until you get a dream that clarifies it for you. According to your dream, the boyfriend aspect of yourself can open the door for you since your family aspects are of no help.
reply_text: James Bassett well 😩 I know what fear this is pertaining too..this solar eclipse and kismet has been no joke for me recently! Hooo boyyyyy, thank you for your insight

post_text: So last night I dreamt about that I was part of some rescue mission in the future. While out in a mission ( trying to rescue people) we started taking on fire from “the enemy”. I was hit in my left thigh. I was then taken to a field doctor to stitch me up. While waiting for the doctor I was able to pull out 2 bullets on my own ( they were .22 c) and then the doctor walked in while I was doing so and just laughed and jumped in to finish. He retrieved 3- .45 c bullets. He cleaned me up, we spoke about the strangeness of the 2 different caliber of billets and then I woke up. Any thoughts?
comment_text: My guess is you foresee that you might need to rescue yourself from something in the future. However you aren't fearful about or afraid of being wounded. The bullets might represent what is wounding you. The different caliber bullets might be symbolizing some wounds are more significant than others. The numbers associated with the calibers could be significant to the dream meaning. Two might be related to a partnership. Four symbolizes stability and 5 is the number of change and freedom. You might feel that while you are capable you might need some professional help to heal/move past some of those wounds.
reply_text: Lauren Wemmer dang, that’s pretty dang deep and actually makes sense. Thank you soooooo much!

I have been having this recurring dream for about a month now. It's gotten to the point where I have trouble sleeping and I wake up gagging. There is a brown horse and he's eating. This is in the middle of a huge city. He's eating a beagle puppy. There's blood and guts and u can see muscles. I can also here the puppy crying and moving. I don't do anything I just watch until I wake up. If anyone has any insight I would appreciate!
comment_text:
I have no skill at interpreting dreams. This is just a guess.

Says here a puppy symbolizes honesty, loyalty and friendship. And a brown horse symbolizes energy, strength, passion, success. Maybe you are coming a little too aggressive on your career at the risk of sabotaging your relationships

post_text:
WARNING graphic content

I have been having this recurring dream for about a month now. It's gotten to the point where I have trouble sleeping and I wake up gagging. There is a brown horse and he's eating. This is in the middle of a huge city. He's eating a beagle puppy. There's blood and guts and u can see muscles. I can also here the puppy crying and moving. I don't do anything I just watch until I wake up. If anyone has any insight I would appreciate!
comment_text: A lot of times dreams can give us warnings to our physical state. Especially from this, the blood, guts, helpless suffering, is your body trying to get your attention. If you're waking up gagging it's very possible you're having acid reflux while you're sleeping and your body is trying to wake you up. Since this is a recurring thing, I would look into it. There are also other issues that occur while sleeping like sleep apnea and what not, but the gagging thing really sounds like reflux
reply_text: If you do feel like this could be the issue. Try taking peppermint tea or the Throat Coat tea by traditional medicinals (available at most grocery stores) before you go to bed. This should settle the stomach and protect the throat. See if the dream still occurs after taking the tea

comment_text: I would interpret this as similar to what Amanuel Solomon has said. For me horses tend to symbolize freedom and/or service to others. Stallions can symbolize male sexuality. The color brown I would link to the earth element, which to me would reinforce the idea of the horse representing service. The beagle puppy evokes a sense of happiness, innocence and family devotion. The dream might have to do with a busy life (big city) grounded in service to others is eating alive/killing your chances of being devoted to family or feelings of innocence and carefree happiness. The blood and guts and muscle might be gore accompanying the service or could be that the emotional situation is having negative physical effects on you or a family member. Since this is a recurring dream the situation is ever present for you and something that you may need to consciously come to terms with.

post_text:
Same exact dream Friday night & again Monday night. I am pulling out of a parking lot onto a busy road. While waiting for a break in traffic so I could go, a young girl with long brown hair & glasses in a black car was turning into the parking lot. The back of her car started to spin & right before her car hit mine she & I locked eyes. On impact the front of her car turned into oncoming traffic & car after car just kept smashing into her car. I could hear her screaming & crashing metal & I cover my face crying. Then everything goes silent, I take my hands off of my eyes & realize I am actually the one in the smashed up car. The car is destroyed & I'm completely trapped inside with the metal so tight against me, I can't move. Then I wake up.

I've tried to look it up but can't put the different scenarios together. Please help?
comment_text: You’re waiting for a break in traffic so you can go, and the car that gets hit is turning into the parking lot. A parking lot and waiting for a break in traffic makes me think that nothing seems to be happening for you at this time and you’d really like to get going but you can’t move, it’s very hard on you. Your plans aren’t working out.

Last night I had many dreams.... First I caught a plate full of Blue Fish. My dad said to clean them and eat them but instead I took half of he plate and threw them back in the water. I was going to pretend I ate them... Then I looked in the water and they were so close to the surface I felt like maybe I should scoop them back up and not lie but.... I let them swim away.
Second.... We were in a house, but it wasn't my house. A storm was coming and my husband and son went to the backyard to secure things and I went to the front yard. I came in and was looking out the back window.... Tornado like Winds we're whipping everything around. My favorite cherry tree was there and a lot bigger than my real life one.... The wind bent my tree right over and I kept thinking it's so flexible it's not breaking.... And then it snapped in half. I was upset but I kept telling myself I can plant a new one. I looked over and y neighbors half built shed was ripped up, my husband was sitting next to pikes of debris exhausted but alive. My son was also tossed around but ok...... And then I woke up 🤷🏻‍♀️.

Real life.... We were served papers for a civil lawsuit that had me in a state of anxiety all day.
comment_text:
The color blue can mean feeling blue, but it’s also a heavenly color; then again, it could mean something very personal to you. There’s a feeling that you should act like you don’t mind something, but you want to just get rid of it. It might refer to eating your words or trying to satisfy a desire.
The storm is all the anxious feelings that have been stirred up. The tree could be representing what your family is going through, and it’s going to be difficult but you tell yourself you can plant another tree and your husband and child will be ok, you’ll survive it.

I'm new. I had a nightmare.
I dreamt that I had a venomous snake inserted into my groin area by my hip, against my will. I was supposed to fight something or someone, or maybe both. I remember feeling it move under my skin. I thought it was a rattlesnake at first, but wasn't, some other venomous thing. I could see the drops of Venum dripping from it's teeth. It would snap at me, strike at me. In one instance it bit, injecting me with a small amount of venom. It didn't kill me in the dream but made me more compliant. I can't remember many details. I remember a man, I remember a hallway in an abandoned building, I think a school maybe. I remember the sun and how it was blindingly bright even in the building it shine through. It seem to be out in a desert maybe? There was dust and dirt everywhere, I could even smell it. I could feel it all, the heat, the dust mixed sweat plastered to my face. It was the stink of war. It felt like there was some kind of battle that was going on but I didn't know why or for what reason. And I was being forced to fight. I was terrified. It was horrible and then I woke up.

I still feel sick to my stomach from it. Can't get it out of my head.

What do you think it means? Anyone have any idea?

Hi all. I can usually figure out what my dreams are about and why I dream them. Not the dream last night. Also, sometimes some of my dreams just don't seem significant. But last night's dream did. I really hope someone can help me figure out what I'm supposed to know. Here's the dream:

I was somewhere, a house maybe, with my husband getting ready to leave so we called an uber. The car came and the driver seemed a little nervous. I just figured he was a new driver. I got in and my husband hadnt come out yet.

. The guy started driving and I was a little concerned because my husband hadnt gotten in. But I reasoned the driver was just going to turn around at the end of the street.

He looked at me in the rear view mirror and smiling he asked if I was comfortable. I said I was. He had a relatively kind smile. But he didn't turn around at the end of the street. He kept going.

He drove right into a giant garbage dump. The garbage was almost up to the door handle of the car and I knew I was in trouble. That's when I saw a brown and white spotted rat. It jumped in the car and into my lap. Of course I was freaking out and it seemed the driver's intention was having me be attacked by rats. But with all my courage I grabbed the rat with both hands and angrily started poking it in the driver's face. I was filled with anger and fear. It didn't faze him. He just sort of chuckled.

And that was it. Nothing else. Everything I read about dream symbols pertaining to rats, being abducted and even the color of the rat wasn't good.

If you've read this far I am grateful and hope you can help me come up with some insight.
comment_text: It could be about something you are doing that husband isn't on board with or your husband could be your logical action oriented side in the dream and you've left that behind as you are pursuing something that turns out to be not as expected and becomes a negative experience for you. Rats and the driver with ill intent might be symbolizing people that seem to be against you. Since the dream deals largely with your destination in the car it might have to do with how your career is going if you work and the feeling of other people spoiling your enjoyment or progress in that area of your life.
reply_text: I also wonder if you haven't been driven into "the dumps" aka feeling down or depressed by the untrustworthy actions of others.

My mum is wery much alive i just told her about this dream. Then suddenly i was in middle of winter war 1939 here in Finland i was trapped in gargo train with refugees from karelia adn russians were shooting us. When i have these kind if dreams i can wake up go to toilet and knowingly go back to that dream. This has puzzeld me for years is that even possible? I always remember my dreams, i see dreams in colors and i see faces clearly sometimes i see people at wake i have dreamed, people i dont know, thats eerie feeling. Do i time travel? I have dreams that i have seen many times in over years and i can cintrol them while i sleep cause in dream i can remember that i have being here before. Thats so weird.

post_text:
Hello. I have a reoccurring dream about the man who used to molest me as a teenager and I need help to understand what it means, I feel like there has to be a reason I keep having it.

I dream that I’m back in my childhood bedroom. It’s not the only bedroom I had in childhood, but it is the one in the home we shared with him, and the room I had through my most formative years. The room is barren, but I’m painting it a baby blue color. Suddenly I notice he’s in the room with me; I’m not sure when he came in, but when I turn around he’s painting over my blue with a dark red. I start screaming “Stop! Can’t you see I’m trying to paint it blue? Why can’t you see that? Stop!” He ignores me, and suddenly the bat I used to play softball with in the time I lived there is in my hands. I start hitting him with it, and I’m crying and saying “Please stop painting it red, I’m trying to paint it blue.” I can feel the resistance of my bat hitting him, I’m swinging as hard as I can, but I never see it hurting him. He continues to standing facing away from me as I hit him.

And that’s where the dream always ends and I wake up having cried in reality during my sleep.
comment_text:
Hi, firstly I am so sorry this man hurt you and that you are still suffering in this way.

My thoughts are that the dream is calling you to do some further work.

Being in the room you shared tells me that the dream is about the mindset you occupy around this issue.

There are allways many threads to the symbols and lots of different ways to approach them. My interpretation is just one suggestion.

It seems the room has been cleared in preparation of remodelling and renovation. Your psyche needs an update in some way.

Yet you used the word "barren" so it may also be that this space internally has become a barren and empty place for you. I wonder if you have tried to clear away the issue in some way, or you just want to paint it over and cover up what happened. Maybe that's something you tried to do when you were young.

Baby blue suggests an innocence. A colour we might paint for a new baby's room. Blue is the colour of the throat chakra, the centre of ouf communication, it invites us to talk and express ourselves, especially verbally. It's also a colour of peace and tranquillity.

I feel that the painting is a way of saying i want to start again. I want to prepare for a new beginning, to clear away the old and welcome in the new. The colour is "light" and invights those themes too.

But the man seems to have too much power because he is allways able to undo your efforts. Red is a very emotive colour bringing thems of lust, passion, danger and anger.

I feel the scene is describing what occupies your mental space over the issue. It seems he is still able to take over and "colour" things. Im sure this experience in many ways has "coloured" or informed the rest of your life, perhaps with a darkness.

Your asking him to stop is very possative because you recognise the unwanted and ongoing influence in your life.

But your pleas and physical attempts to make it stop are not working. And I feel this probably the crux of it. It's very very sad and unfair, this man violated you when you were a powerless. He broke the law, the trust of your family and broke every sacred boundary that is held by good decent loving people. The softball racquet I feel represents your efforts as a child who mearly did not have the power to make it stop by her own efforts. That was not your fault and I feel the dream is repeating because it wants to call you forward as the adult you now are. It's replaying this internal video because its still playing out in various ways within you. You need to address the issue to get the dream to change and hopefully stop.

If this were my dream I would look towards finding a good psychotherapist
and begin by bringing them the dream. There is obviously a lot of pent up emotion that is being held within you.

The painting shows that you want to start over. Painting your own childhood room and the location of your pain, suggests you want to welcome the child who you were. She still lives within you, painting her room in a new and fresh way invites healing and saftey and a way to refresh yourself for a new start. I feel a psychotherapist
will be able to help you with this. Make sure it's not a councellor though as they wont have the expertise. You need someone trained in dealing with these specific traumas. Thank you for sharing your dream with us and taking a very posative step towards healing xx I wish you much courage and live as you move forward x
reply_text: Alexandra Moulding I love this comment so much!

reply_text: Chenneil Steele Alexandra has done a very good job of interpretation of your dream. I agree with her on almost every point. I would add that trying to cover the walls with baby blue is a sign of you wishing to put it all behind you with a new idea represented by baby. Baby blue is a mixture of blue and white. Blue is the color of wisdom and white is the color of spirituality. Your molester is a mental aspect of yourself that you are trying to clear out. Do this every night until you get an answer. Your subconscious will provide the answer for you.

post_text:
Hello. I have a reoccurring dream about the man who used to molest me as a teenager and I need help to understand what it means, I feel like there has to be a reason I keep having it.

I dream that I’m back in my childhood bedroom. It’s not the only bedroom I had in childhood, but it is the one in the home we shared with him, and the room I had through my most formative years. The room is barren, but I’m painting it a baby blue color. Suddenly I notice he’s in the room with me; I’m not sure when he came in, but when I turn around he’s painting over my blue with a dark red. I start screaming “Stop! Can’t you see I’m trying to paint it blue? Why can’t you see that? Stop!” He ignores me, and suddenly the bat I used to play softball with in the time I lived there is in my hands. I start hitting him with it, and I’m crying and saying “Please stop painting it red, I’m trying to paint it blue.” I can feel the resistance of my bat hitting him, I’m swinging as hard as I can, but I never see it hurting him. He continues to standing facing away from me as I hit him.

And that’s where the dream always ends and I wake up having cried in reality during my sleep.
comment_text:
Hi, firstly I am so sorry this man hurt you and that you are still suffering in this way.

My thoughts are that the dream is calling you to do some further work.

Being in the room you shared tells me that the dream is about the mindset you occupy around this issue.

There are allways many threads to the symbols and lots of different ways to approach them. My interpretation is just one suggestion.

It seems the room has been cleared in preparation of remodelling and renovation. Your psyche needs an update in some way.

Yet you used the word "barren" so it may also be that this space internally has become a barren and empty place for you. I wonder if you have tried to clear away the issue in some way, or you just want to paint it over and cover up what happened. Maybe that's something you tried to do when you were young.

Baby blue suggests an innocence. A colour we might paint for a new baby's room. Blue is the colour of the throat chakra, the centre of ouf communication, it invites us to talk and express ourselves, especially verbally. It's also a colour of peace and tranquillity.

I feel that the painting is a way of saying i want to start again. I want to prepare for a new beginning, to clear away the old and welcome in the new. The colour is "light" and invights those themes too.

But the man seems to have too much power because he is allways able to undo your efforts. Red is a very emotive colour bringing thems of lust, passion, danger and anger.

I feel the scene is describing what occupies your mental space over the issue. It seems he is still able to take over and "colour" things. Im sure this experience in many ways has "coloured" or informed the rest of your life, perhaps with a darkness.

Your asking him to stop is very possative because you recognise the unwanted and ongoing influence in your life.

But your pleas and physical attempts to make it stop are not working. And I feel this probably the crux of it. It's very very sad and unfair, this man violated you when you were a powerless. He broke the law, the trust of your family and broke every sacred boundary that is held by good decent loving people. The softball racquet I feel represents your efforts as a child who mearly did not have the power to make it stop by her own efforts. That was not your fault and I feel the dream is repeating because it wants to call you forward as the adult you now are. It's replaying this internal video because its still playing out in various ways within you. You need to address the issue to get the dream to change and hopefully stop.

If this were my dream I would look towards finding a good psychotherapist
and begin by bringing them the dream. There is obviously a lot of pent up emotion that is being held within you.

The painting shows that you want to start over. Painting your own childhood room and the location of your pain, suggests you want to welcome the child who you were. She still lives within you, painting her room in a new and fresh way invites healing and saftey and a way to refresh yourself for a new start. I feel a psychotherapist
will be able to help you with this. Make sure it's not a councellor though as they wont have the expertise. You need someone trained in dealing with these specific traumas. Thank you for sharing your dream with us and taking a very posative step towards healing xx I wish you much courage and live as you move forward x
reply_text: Alexandra Moulding your comment ❣️...well said, agree with it 💯

comment_text: As someone whose also experienced sexual trauma, I have had dreams like this. I see the painting of the room as you setting out your life and goals and making plans for what your life will look like. Him painting over your blue I think represents how his actions have changed the colour of your experience. I think the meaning of the colours is significant too, blue being a safe and peaceful colour vs the red representing violence and anger and negativity. Your act of hitting him not affecting him I think probably represents your retaliation to the trauma he put you through and feeling like even if you fight back it’s not going to be effective. I think the reason you’re having this dream is to process the loss of childhood and innocence and control over life. This is just my interpretation and I might be projecting a little given my own experience but hopefully that resonates with you.

comment_text:
Emma Leigh Espinosa the interpretations
above are beautiful. I think this sounds useful, what has been said. To add to this is the dream image of a bedroom can mean one's own privacy, one's own unconscious, and one's view of sexuality. Which he has given you a darker view of these things than you naturally would have. Softball means you are not "playing hardball" you do not feel that you were tough enough about what happened to you.

I am going to make a suggestion of what to do which was advice my mother gave to me when I was a child and would have the same nightmares over and over.

She told me, before I go to sleep, to tell myself about the monsters "i am not afraid of you!" She said if anything is chasing you in a dream, to turn around and face it "you don't scare me, you can't hurt me, I am not afraid of you!" And it will be less scary once you face it. I think this is true in waking life working through c-ptsd triggers, and it is true in dreams as well.

If you keep hitting him with the bat in the dream, see if you can try having any awareness in the dream that you can try something else. You could try "this is my room. You are not allowed in here"

Or simply "you don't hurt me, you can't scare me, I am not afraid of you"

Because he turns his back on you in the dream, and because also about how others commented on "painting over" can mean to try to cover or conceal the surface, it makes me think that the dream is about "facing him"

You can do this in a dream, by looking into his face and telling him "you can't hurt me anymore I am not afraid of you"

But as mentioned, you can do this in therapy or journaling.

There is an option where you could ask a therapist about "role play" the idea of the therapist standing in for this abuser while you tell him what it is you need to say to him.

You can also do this with mental rehearsal of conversations and or with letters

A "confrontation fantasy" which is either imagined, or played out in therapy, or that eventually actually happens in real life - this is a huge part of healing from sexual abuse 💖

Much love to you in your healing journey 💙💜 the fact that you are having the dream is showinghow strong and resilient that you truly are, that you are recovering and gaining strength and working through this. It sounds like you are at a close point to having a breakthrough and that's why your mind is nudging you with these dreams

There is no way out, but through 💙 keep going and you will get there! 💚

Why us he painting it red? Danger perhaps? Blood? The bat, a phallic shaped object, you turned the "wood" back on him because that's how you felt perhaps, that he was hitting you constantly with his "bat" behind your back? Overall it's the feelings that matter. Those feelings in the dream are the feelings he made you feel. That's what wants to come out.

comment_text: I truly wish there was a single definition of dream symbols that would allow everyone to interpret their own dreams, but there is no such definition. For me, baby blue is a light color of blue and is a mixture of blue and white. In my thirty plus years of dreaming and interpreting, blue is the color of wisdom and white is the color of spirituality. Red is the color of emotion and since it is a dark red, it would be a very deep emotion which would be understandable in this dream. For you Emma, I sincerely hope what I have said is of some help for you.

comment_text:
Thank you for all your interpretations
, I had been at work all day and was unable to respond sooner. I really appreciate these perspectives that shed light on it in a way I wouldn’t have managed on my own easily.

I have sought therapy a couple times before, but with a counselor and without success as I found it hard to be open with a stranger face-to-face, so I never went past the first session. I know I have a lot to unpack aside from this. I think it would be fair to say I have not had a chance to truly process as people in my life I have tried opening up to either found it awkward, got so angry I can’t even say the person’s name in front of them, or have abandoned me after revealing my abusers identity to them.

I don’t blame the former two, it’s not their jobs to help me process my trauma. I’ll look into psychotherapist
s in my area. I tend to try to repress and forget, and I’ve wanted to be a better version of myself than I am now for a while, I wish to be happier, I just don’t feel like I am worth the effort a lot of the time and don’t have the tools.

This was a wake up call that I need to confront this as it’s obviously still affecting me more than I would like to think.

Thanks again 💜
reply_text: Emma Leigh Espinosa good luck in your therapy journey, it will be worth it if you stick at it x

reply_text: Emma Leigh Espinosa each therapist is different, it will take possibly a bit off effort to find the right person, if you dont feel you can open up, it might not be the right therapist. I have had the best luck and pricing finding a therapist through a therapy school, where the teacher will do an initial interview with you and consider which one of the students is a best match with you. Also though there is a lot of online therapy options now which might feel easier than in person. There are other options too, like group therapy, or taking courses - sometimes these are offered at community centres or through hospitals and clinics or even churches, and may be offered for free or affordable. There can be options too like art therapy, if talk therapy is not helping as much. Or because trauma is stored in the body, yoga can help. Yoga, massage, and also mindfulness and meditation. There are a lot of youtube videos and free resources of these type of options. It sounds like the dream is coming up because you feel stronger and able to look at the issue for healing. That is amazing 💖 if you do try talk therapy, keep in mind that for the first little while, month or couple of months, you might feel worse. And then it gets a lot better than you have felt before! It is similar to like the gym workouts, if you are out of shape the new fitness routine is super hard on your body and you feel extra tired and achy. But then you grow muscle! And you have stamina! It is like that when you start therapy. You are digging through a lot of past issues, it might be that they were lying dormant for a while. It is unpleasant and uncomfortable and first. And then it gets so much better. So if you do it, dont be afraid if at first it feels hard. It gets so much better! If you stick with it for a while 💙 thanks so much for sharing your dream in the group

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

post_text:
Had such an odd dream!!
It was like I was back in another time and men were very domineering over women, it seemed like the men were treating their women like slaves and they were getting paid for it, like a pension. Even though the men were working, they were getting some extra cash from the government for having a wife but the women were unaware of this injustice. It was like they were imprisoned in their own homes.
So I walked into a house and started demanding that the women be set free and aware of what was going on. It wasn’t about breaking up a marriage, it was more about giving them some freedom, I just sensed a mass injustice. This guy was trying to overpower me so I basically told him I will absolutely beat the crap out of him if he keeps doing this. He was being a smart arse so I grabbed him and started punching him in the face and then his wife was free.
I then followed her and then we kissed.

Next moment I was somewhere looking at some cycle, like it was repeating itself and I said to my son about things never change! I wish I could remember the details more but it was like I kept seeing the same things

Now makes me wonder if I did something in history and now I’m paying for it 🤔
comment_text: It could just simply be a reflection of what you see going on in society and thinking that it’s like old patterns never change, they just keep recycling.
reply_text: Rita Catherine thanks

post_text: I recently had a dream I was in a Cathedral church with my Grandma and a man I never seen. My Grandma was in a wedding dress with a bouquet of white flowers and 2 pink flowers. It starts off with us walking in the church, then I was sitting in the pews and my Grandma walking out the church saying She needed to go find St. Anthony. After that my Grandma was lost and we couldnt find her. I woke right after that. My Grandma is still alive.
comment_text:
Grandma could be symbolizing your inner female wisdom. Wearing a wedding dress and pink flowers in a church could have to do with making a commitment to self love and spirituality/
religion. St. Anthony is patron saint of lost objects and lost people. Perhaps you have lost some connection to the church or your spirituality that you wish to regain.

post_text:
Okay weird one..
Saturday night around 10/11pm I was quite irritated I wasn’t falling asleep since I had a lot to do as soon as my feet hit the floor Sunday morning. I had been laying there for quite some time with my eyes closed. I opened my eyes (without my glasses mind you) and saw what looked like a Black Sea urchin but with not as many spikes and very wiggly. It was RIGHT infront of my face. I gasped and leaned back away from it. I watched it for about 30 seconds move. It slowly made it way to a shadow on the wall almost like it was hiding just out of sight in the shadow. I closed my eyes obviously and willed it away I suppose. I rolled over and forced myself to sleep. But man oh man what the hell was that?

I have been a sufferer of sleep paralysis and have also done my research on Hypnagogic hallucinations. I had a occurrence earlier in the year that was very similar to this but it was a swarm of beetles flying and crawling into the upper door way of my bedroom. The night before this recent occurrence, my four year old son woke up talking about dreaming of beetles. Maybe that part is a coincidence. But, please leave me your thoughts. Thanks! 🙂😅
comment_text: I think it’s your eyes/brain playing tricks.
reply_text: Rita Catherine hmm okay thanks for your opinion. I will add I was completely awake.
