post_text:
Dream Rant:💭
Every night before bed for the first 2 months after my mom's death I would manifest that I wanted to see her in my dreams. She only appeared a few times though. Now every night I can't help but think of how much I miss her right before falling asleep, not manifesting anything & now I dream of her almost daily...
Half of the times the dreams are the same thing. She died but then somehow she came back to life. But somehow I knew she was going to die again so I would call or text her frequently to check up on her to make sure she's okay but I was always scared when she didn't respond...sometimes it took her weeks to respond (in real life she was the opposite).

Why am I so scared of loosing her again even though she's already gone?
comment_text:
I'm so sorry you mum has died. In my opinion not all the dreams we have of our departed loved ones are visitations. This series of dreams you are having, to me, feel like greif dreams. If you had spent a long time asking her to appear in your dreams, and usually focus on your sorrow before sleep, then there's probably a lot for the dreaming mind to work through. Its not unusual to dream soon after loss that our loved ones never really died, or that they have come back to life. Its so unbeleivable they have gone, we miss them so much and it takes time for the heart and soul to come to terms with the fact they have passed on. It seems you are dreaming that you can communicate with her which is probably something you wish you could still do, and is indded the purpose of your manifestation request. I feel the part where she dosnt respond to your messages is the dreams attempt to help you adjust to the fact that she has gone.

If you find the dreams upsetting you can ask the dream to help you accept your loss in another way. Perhaps you could ask your mum to show her loving spirit in other ways too.

Sending you my warmest condolences x

post_text: Had a dream last night where I met a girl on the beach, got to know her a bit, and watched the sunset with her and my family. Soon after, a great prehistoric-looking water creature showed up and the creature's minions forced her to get eaten while I could do nothing to save her. Feeling horrible, I moped about for a while until I obtained help from my family and a scientist. Together, we searched for solutions on how to go back in time and save her. We eventually did just that destroying the creature in the process. However, no matter what we did, there was always something off about the timeline. I imagine this may have multiple meanings so what's your take on it?
comment_text: The sunset could mean something drawing to a close. The girl may be representing your emotions that are eating you up and you’re feeling helpless to do anything about it. You’re looking for a solution to this. The scientist may represent trying to be more logical and less emotional. Going back in time may mean reviewing the past and what happened back then. The timeline is off...maybe that means you’re still waiting to make the right connection?
reply_text: Rita Catherine You're probably right about me wanting to make the right connection. I often feel like I'm waiting to make a connection with the right girl and feel helpless when I see a girl getting close to someone else. I know I need a solution for this since I want something to happen, but nothing is currently happening. Admittedly, I often review the past just to understand where I went wrong in my approach. So this all definitely has something to do with my waking life.

post_text:
My dreams are usually very vivid and sometimes come true. God Forbid this were to ever come true, but if I don't put it out here, I'm never sleeping tonight.

I was at my house after work with friends hanging out. There was string in one of their hairs, so I started pulling it out. Then, her hair started coming with it. It was like 3 feet of her hair, although it wasn't that long. We talked about how weird it was, but didn't think much of if.i asked if I should just throw it away, admiring how soft and thick it was.

As we were having this conversation, we heard a vehicle driving around making frequent stops and getting closer. As the vehicle approaches and stops, I get a weird feeling and quickly throw the hair in the trash. My friend was sitting on the front stairs of the porch, and I was right inside the door with the other friend in the kitchen. .

I hear this man ask if my friend is "Danielle". This is my daughter's name and she says yes. (Somehow in this dream she changed people). He walks over and asks her to go with him. He is a super creep. I ask h8m to leave and he sits and keeps talking. I ask my other friend to get my g.un, she does.

I've asked him to leave again, but doesn't and is closer. I have it ready to go and pointed. As my friend asks if I'm OK, I said yes and the accidentally pulled the tri.g.g.er kill ing him .

The next scene, my daughter is gone, the guy was in a printer machine, like folded up and it seems that that is where he was when the prior event happened. My friend had turned into a different friend and we were trying to figure out the best way to dispose 9f it...

Then, I panicked, wondering how long fingerprints stay on bullets, that eventually I would be caught. Then, I was gonna call the cops and claim self defense but trealized how stupid that would be, because he was in a printer now.

This is when I woke up.

Help?

Background, my daughter did just deliver a baby, he has a severe genetic condition and she has post Partum Depression. The baby was admitted for 13 days and I finally had to go fight ti get then home. I di own a g.un, but I feel like I would never need to do what I did IRL

I'm not sure if it has something to do with this and if so, how/what? There isn't really anything else significant happening in life right now.
comment_text:
You had to stay focused in order to get them home and you had to take the action that you felt was right. Maybe the guilt is from wondering if you did the right thing? Or if you could have handled it in a different way? The creepy guy might be her depression. I’m not sure what the printer is representing...
did they give any kind of printout about her diagnosis? The hair may be your thoughts about everything; it being soft may mean you’re feeling compassion for your daughter.
Best wishes for her recovery 💐
reply_text:
Thank you for responding. Also, I'm so sorry that it was typed so funny, I did it the moment I woke up, so I didn't forget and I wanted to make sure the trigger words were not there for FB censors.

I didn't really feel guilt, just didn't want to be caught, it was weird, but handling the situation in a different way.... I had it out with a doctor, who was just a resident. He didn't have a good bedside manner at all working with a PPD mom. I may have shot him down there. 🙂

The only printed thing was the discharge papers and the baby's EKG readouts.

Thank you for your kind thoughts and comments.

post_text:
*massively long one, containing some violence and gore*

Yet another vivid dream. That's 2 days in a row now. This one has more of an obvious meaning but there's still some gaps that are missing for me.

My mum, my dad and my sister went to the library for research on something (can't remember what). Only me and my sister were allowed in because of Covid for some reason, so mum and dad went back to the car outside.

My sister and I sat at a computer. It was odd because she was around 6 years old in my dream, but she's coming up to 12 years old soon in reality. She was acting very mature and I don't know if it's relevant or not but she had a terrible cold, that of course I was worried was Covid. We got on very well and I looked after her like a parent would their own child.

Suddenly, I'm rushing to get back to the car but my sister was no longer there. I lose my phone somewhere and I'm freaking out massively. I really needed my phone and I felt incredibly unsafe without it.

Now I'm at my mum's and going through loads of bags to try and find my phone. I went upstairs in a panic and found my dad drinking in secret. *In reality my dad is an alcoholic but has been sober (at least that's what he tells me) since being in hospital in December last year* I was so angry and I started screaming at him, telling him how selfish he is and that he knows what will happen if he keeps going.

I went back downstairs, because I was done with him, and had a message waiting for me (I'm assuming on someone else's phone) saying that they had my phone and was bringing it round.

I answer the door and find a man in a mask. He hands me a white iPhone, which I know isn't mine but I take it anyway. I go to close the door and he pulls out a small knife that he proceeds to hold against my rib cage.
"You're not even going to pay me for that phone" he says.
I scream and my dad appears. I tell him this guy has got a knife on me but my dad doesn't seem to do anything.

It's a bit blurry at this point, but somehow the man gets stabbed to death. I'm not sure if I did it or what. I find out by the police that he was a very dangerous serial killer and has brutally murdered and disemboweled hundreds of women, of which they showed me photos. It was very disturbing.

Now I'm standing near some railings overlooking the sea. There are some people around me and one person calls my number. I find my phone at the bottom of my bag and I lose control of my emotions.
I look up to the sky and thank God, over and over again, for allowing me to find my phone. I was hysterical and couldn't breathe, clutching onto the railings as I sobbed.

I'm still crying in my mum's living room. I pulled out the iPhone from earlier and noticed it belonged to someone called Kate. I put a post on FB trying to find her so I could give her the phone back. Then I was told that she was one of the man's victims.

Again, I lose control of my emotions and wonder why all of this was happening.

Then I wake up.
Any thoughts?
comment_text: Could you discuss what you see as the obvious meaning and what you don’t understand? That would make it easier.
reply_text: Rita Catherine yeah, sorry. So the obvious meaning to me is in relation to the parts of my dream involving my dad. I think I have a lot of repressed anger towards him and current anxieties, and perhaps don't feel as protected by him as I should. That's all I can get from the whole dream

Oji Lea having a bad cold could mean feeling cold to your father because of his behavior and that if he cared he would listen to you. The loss of the phone could be representing the loss of being able to communicate all of your feelings and what is going on with you. A serial killer is someone who does the same thing over and over again. This has to end.

post_text:
Hi all. Thank you for the add.

This morning I dreamt I was waking up and started bleeding, like a period. There’s not much more to the dream than that. I wiped on toilet paper and was so disappointed.

Real life: I accidentally conceived an unplanned baby. We decided to keep it, but lost it on 4/20/22 due to miscarriage at 7 weeks. Now we are planning to conceive again. We’ve “baby danced” twice since the bleeding stopped. I felt a tiny bit of cramping yesterday. Maybe ovulation? I’ve read ovulation could happen as soon as 14 days after miscarriage, but it would only be day 12 yesterday. I also woke up with bad headache this morning. Wondering if this is a sign of anything good or bad in relation to fertility. 😬
comment_text:
The dream could be helping you process the emotion of disappointment (or even accessing the grief over loss). I believe the recommended period to try again is 3 months to allow your body to replenish/
restore itself but do look it up. Probably best to allow yourself some time and prioritise yourself.
Bleeding in dream could also indicate some other things.
reply_text:
Akva Dabra I wondered about that too. Thank you for responding!

Apparently the recommendation used to be to wait for three months, but that has changed, and now there’s no evidence suggesting it’s necessary to wait, and in fact, supposedly you’re more fertile in those first three months after a miscarriage. But who knows, because science changes!

But I have seen to wait at least one cycle if you’ve gotten a d&c. Thank you, again!

post_text:
I had a dream months ago that I can't seem to get off my brain. When I do dream they are vivid and many details. My dreams come true. I've had many dreams where there's no way my subconscious could possibly know what is going to take place yet it happens. This one dream I can't seem to shake.

I died in my sleep. I was a spirit. There was someone talking to me. I don't recall seeing what it looked like. The feeling I had is so hard to describe as I've never felt something like it. There was no pain, no worrying, no fear. Just calm, relaxing and pure peace. I don't feel like my description justify how wonderful it actually felt. The voice asked if I was ready to move on. I stated back that I'm going to stay here with my children. Weather I'm alive or a spirit I'm not going to leave them. I will stay with them to help them through their lives. When they have children I will be here for them too. Shortly after this I woke up. The feeling of complete peace lingered in my body. I was happy, relaxed and calm when I woke up. It was such an incredible feeling.

Even though I don't have any beliefs of what comes after death, I'm not scared of death. So I know my dream is not a fear of me dying. I have searched for a meaning and anything I come across, I'm not able to relate to. I do question if I agreed to move on if I would have actually died. I'll never know because no matter what I will always stick behind my decision.

Anyone have a thought of what the purpose of this dream was?
comment_text: Jennifer Susan to be clear this is just one persons opinion. I'm not going to interpret this symbolically. Because to me...this fits exactly with what I personally believe happens after we leave this body. Right down to the calm and peaceful feelings. In my mind...this world is like a school. We come here to learn very specific things we can only experience in a physical body. Then we go back to our natural spirit state. The person talking to you was your guide. And as on earth, we also have choices to make in spirit state. I see this dream as an affirmation.

post_text:
What does it mean to always have my ex in the background of all my dreams heckling me?

Basically my ex was emotionally abusive and manipulative, cheated on me, and I found out in a way that left me very mentally unstable for a long time. Years later now I'm happily married to someone else, but I continue to be haunted by dreams of my ex still giving me a hard time about things, making me feel bad about myself, or just randomly in the background of my dreams making snarky comments.

If anything, I thought my dreams were a way for me to finally tell him off and get the last word out, but it doesn't stop.
comment_text: Have you cut all energy cords to him?

post_text:
What does it mean to always have my ex in the background of all my dreams heckling me?

Basically my ex was emotionally abusive and manipulative, cheated on me, and I found out in a way that left me very mentally unstable for a long time. Years later now I'm happily married to someone else, but I continue to be haunted by dreams of my ex still giving me a hard time about things, making me feel bad about myself, or just randomly in the background of my dreams making snarky comments.

If anything, I thought my dreams were a way for me to finally tell him off and get the last word out, but it doesn't stop.
comment_text:
I think at times there is a way that someone's negative attitude towards us we can internalize that negative attitude and it can later lead to self doubt.

Part of this is because we stayed in the relationship, so we were accepting those comments, in some way, it got internalized, like "maybe their criticisms are correct"

I think if your ex shows up in your dreams, it is a symbol of someone you KNOW not to listen to, you KNOW is negative and doesn't want the best for you, you KNOW you want this negativity out of your life.

Therefore, if your ex shows up in dreams complaining about you, it can be a sign of:

1. In waking life, you are being accepting and welcoming of someone else's negativity. You can find a way to cut this down or to stand up for yourself, if you have this situation to deal with

2. That you have been having negative thoughts about yourself, and you know those aren't true, so it is time to cut that out and be lovelier and sweeter to yourself 💜

My two cents Ali Pinlac it doesn't mean this person is coming back in your life, it means they represent a symbol of criticism which you know is overly harsh, and something in your waking life is reminding you of that.

Hi! I had two very weird dream about my ex. If anyone could help me i would appreciate it so much!
The first one starts off as I was with my mom and two siblings, we were riding down a backroad and I turn around my ex is literally sitting in the floorboard of her back seat just staring at me. He never said anything to me. I woke up.
The next one was about him checking my snapchat story but in real life he blocked me on everything, I tried to watch his story in my dream but he was at an amusement park with i guess his new girlfriend.. I don’t know this girl at all but he looked pretty happy with her..
I also keep seeing his name everywhere and car in real life.
comment_text: Sounds like your ex is in the back of your mind (notice you mention back twice in back roads and back seat). That would also account for seeing his name pop up everywhere and noticing his car. Your mind is paying attention even if you aren't consciously thinking of him.

post_text: Had the weirdness dream ever I was like in space all dark floating around and looking for my mum which I was upset about as could not find her. thing is she is still alive very strange
comment_text: Mom can be symbolizing a part of you that you might have felt was lacking in some recent situation. Moms often represent things like , emotions, nurturing, compassion, comfort and sometimes your conscience. What your mom represents would depend on her personality and your relationship with her.

post_text: I dreamed about driving on a rural road with farming fields in broad daylight on a sunny day. I was driving slow. I saw two people walking in the opposite direction I looked at their facial expressions they looked happy and they were laughing. Can anyone help interpret this dream?
comment_text: Sounds like a good dream, like you are enjoying the present moment in your life.

post_text:
Hello everyone , I would like to tell you about my dream, which at first sight seems trivial, but I was anxious all day because of it.
I was at home, it was night and there were noises on the stairs, when I got out of bed to see what it was about and I went to look at the viewfinder I saw a horse , he was running agitatedly up the stairs then he started banging his head on my door ,he wanted to break down the door and hurt me. He was mad and had red eyes.
His colour was brown , if it matters..

If anyone can help me with an interpretation or if anyone else has had a similar dream I would like you to tell me …
Thank you so much!🥺🙏
comment_text: Hello, a horse can represent horsepower, the freedom to ride your own horse over fields of your own choosing. You’re being nudged to get going...maybe on learning something or following your creative passion...

comment_text: The horse could represent your emotions running amok...

post_text: I apologize if this is long, but i need to give a back story for ppl to really understand. Let me start by saying, I am 51 yrs old now. Many yrs ago, my family lived in a neighborhood with alot of kids. We only lived there for 2 yrs and during that time, I was 14 and 15 yrs old. There was a boy who had a huge crush on me, I will call him john. I was a bit of a tomboy and i didn't have the same feelings for him. To me he was just a friend. He loved hanging out with me so he accepted being just a "buddy", tho i knew his feelings were deeper. We were together all the time for 2 yrs, then we had a bad argument and i wouldn't hang out with him anymore. Shortly after, we moved from there and i never saw him again. But everytime i ran into to ppl from the neighborhood, they would tell me how devastated he was. Even adults told me he must have been truly in love with me, even at such a young age. Now fast forward, all these decades later, I have started having recurring dreams about John. For several months now, at least 3 times a week, I dream that we run into each other and we are sooo happy to have found each other again. In the dreams, we are both willing to leave our current partners and do whatever it takes to be together. The real strange thing is...when I wake up, I am very sad and disappointed that it was just a dream! I wake up feeling like i have lost something very special in my life. Let me add that i am happily married to my partner of the last 10 yrs. I hate to sound cold, but at the time john and i parted ways all those yrs ago, it seemed insignificant to me. I had no romantic feelings for him then, so why in the world would i have them now? Or perhaps the dream isnt really about john, perhaps he represents something else? Any insight would be appreciated, and sorry it was so long. Lol
comment_text: He is probably an Animus figure, or your inner masculine part. I think the feelings associated with the Animus part are what we really want to give ourselves to feel completely whole. It's unconditional love and acceptance as we are, flaws and all. He probably symbolizes that because he had such a huge crush and wanted to be around you even though you didn't feel the same for him and because the relationship was during your formative years.

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thank you for allowing me to join this group!

post_text:
Atleast twice a month I have a dream that I am running away or in a hurry to pack my things and head to safety. They are so frequent and I remember them all in very great detail. Sometimes I'm hiding in a bedroom pulling clothes out of drawers packing a bag. Sometimes I'm carrying my daughter trying to hide her from something and looking for weapons in the room to defend myself. Sometimes I give my daughter to someone else to protect her and I spend the rest of the dream looking for her. But I am always in a hurry and feeling scared and threatened. Always looking for an open window or a bag to pack up my things.

Any ideas as to why I keep having these exact same kind of dreams so frequently?
comment_text: I woukd suggest this is your go-to dream whenever you feel vulnerable in some way. There are themes of "I'm not prepared" "i might get hurt" "I must stay in controll" etc.

post_text:
This one had me waking up in tears!

I dreamed that I died. I was a spirit but my family could still see and hear me. But one by one, they stopped being able to see me. Then one by one, they stopped being able to hear me. The dream ends with me screaming and trying to grab my mom's hand but no one even knows I'm there.

It just has to mean something, right?
comment_text:
Hi, my thoughts are this dream is a wake up call and a call to action.

What part of you has died?

Where in your life are you beginning to become invisible?

What part of your life or personality is no one seeing anymore?

It seems it's still there, because it's a part of your spirit, an essential part of who you are yet it has been allowed to fall away. Perhaps you are no longer nurturing this side of youself?

The dream, to me, calls you to revive yourself. You must nurture these essential aspects of your being. Do it before even you yourself forget who you are.
reply_text: Alexandra Moulding thank you for this perspective.

comment_text: Hi Maria. I would interpret this as you are comfortable with you life path forward

post_text: Hello! I dreamed that I was wearing white, clean and very comfortable shoes with laces.
comment_text: You feel a sense of pride for being a decent human being.

post_text: Hello! I dreamed that I was wearing white, clean and very comfortable shoes with laces.
comment_text: White is a symbol of prosperity . White shoes r indicating prosperous journey ahead

post_text: Hello! I dreamed that I was wearing white, clean and very comfortable shoes with laces.
comment_text:
Very rarely will the dream give you a symbol that is only positive. What I mean by this is, the dream loves you so much that it keeps providing you with the feedback on how to evolve. And in order to do that, it will tell you what is holding you back, needs to be changed etc..
Shoes is usually a pun on issues. The meaning of white can represent (self) criticism, living too cleanly. Laces would represent being tied/limited/
constricted/
reined in/by this issue.
Dream is inviting you to look at this aspect of your life and where it may apply and become actually more comfortable around certain things.
The thing is 'the white' is probably useful in one area of life but may hinder the other.
Hope this helps.

post_text: Hello! I dreamed that I was wearing white, clean and very comfortable shoes with laces.
comment_text: My symbol for white is spirituality. Shoes are the coverings or protections of basic understanding (feet). To me this dream is telling you that you are very comfortable in your spiritual understanding.

post_text: Hello! I dreamed that I was wearing white, clean and very comfortable shoes with laces.
comment_text: Maria - As you can see from the answers above there is no one who can tell you with absolute assuredness that their interpretation is correct. That is why I included the following caveat in my book on the subject: EVERYTTHING IN THIS BOOK MAY BE WRONG.

post_text:
Hi Everyone,
I had a dream about twin biracial girls . They were absolutely beautiful around the ages of 10 years old. They had blue eyes and I can remember myself trying to see if I recognized their energy. While the girls talked to me, I noticed they were both extremely different. I can remember talking to them and one of the girls talked about how she was connected to her roots, and although she was biracial she didn't feel any connection to her European side.She identified herself as Black. The other twin explain that she was well connected to her European side and also said she wanted no parts of her African Ancestry Side. This twin identified herself as White . They were both sweet girls , but I reiterate they're completely different. This dream felt real, but I don't understand it.Im not European, however I have European relatives down the line. I don't understand how this applies, please give me some insight.

P.S : This post is not made to offend or disturb any race or ethnicity . I love based off of personality ♥️💜
comment_text:
Twins can represent harmony or it can represent opposites and ambivalence. Black and white can represent balance (yin-yang).
Maybe you’re thinking you like two things equally well because both are beautiful to you even tho they seem very different.
reply_text: Rita Catherine Absolutely Beautiful! Thank you so much!

post_text: I had a dream that I was at my home about to steam clean my den.. but when I looked outside and seen a little kid running and I went to the door and I had family bring me balloons and cards.. it was mothers day(my guess) I was so happy and was emotional that they thought of me. One weird thing is that we were at my family house in the yard and not my home were I remembered so things kinda switched up. We were outside and I was about to read a letter from one of the cards and as I was about to read it to see who it was from, a lady hollered about somebody spoke of this and from what I get from it they may have manifested something and it was coming true and they began to point out people who this person said that this was going to experience this.. they were happy about it and my guess is the person passed on and said things before their death… well out of nowhere, we saw a big orange red light.. kinda looked like the sun. minutes later we discovered that it was fire.. fire began to fill the trees and we started running to the house.. I even saw a car on fire and it was still riding… Can anyone dissect this and tell me if this makes any sense?
comment_text: The dream indicates feeling optimistic for the future, something to celebrate and be happy about. Something you have wanted is being manifested. Orange red light as big as the sun could be representing that you’re feeling the energy and passion of accomplishing something, like you’re on fire. The car is your drive and ambition to get you where you want to go. You’re on your way.

So I’m not sure if this was a dream, or some other sleep disturbance, but it was pretty strange. I’d love if someone could explain why this happened/what category of sleep event this was.

post_text: I just woke up from an odd dream. I was at my work, and had walked to my car. I saw teenagers leaning against my car. One was sitting on my car window. I came closer, he had broken my window. He looked kike he didnt give a care. I grabbed him by his shirt, made him look at the damage, and I told him, " you see what you did?! You! Are gonna pay for this damage!! Go get paper and a pen, and I want your parents number. DO YOU HEAR WHAT I SAID???". I was so raged, I was having a hard time texting my manager. I know me shouting and angry in the dream means I'm blowing off steam from waking life. What does broken window would mean?
comment_text:
Hi , i have a few suggestions for you. It could be to do with your behaviour in regards to how you move forward in life. That may or may not also have ties work and career.

Something about your teenage self is obscuring your outlook and your view is broken in some way. Think about how old the teens were in the dream and what was going on for you at that age. If it were my dream I would be looking for my own behaviours then and seeing what traits I still hold.

It may be the "I don't care" is an arrogance you hold, this could be a reactionary habit formed at that time in order to self protect.

I feel that the confrontation is about looking at yourself and confronting the issue. What has been broken within you and what is responsible for that damage? How have the events of your teenage years damaged your ability to move forward with clear sight.

I feel the need to contact the parents suggests that you would like your own parents or upbringing to take some responsability for the damage.

The manager is you and your own internal management system. It may be that you have a lot of repressed anger and rage carried forward from that time. The "I don't care" might be an attitude formed though not being able to change a situation. Sometimes if we have no agency we detratch or disassociate as it's the only option we have at the time that allows us to escape and avoid facing the emotions we have.

This is one possible interpretation.
Others might offer alternatives of course.

post_text:
Hello all! Last night I had a dream I was in my car with my window half open. On my left side a little bit up the road I seen a tractor on the banks of the river. It was somehow spraying muddy water from the back, as if it was trying to get unbogged. I knew what was going to happen as I passed the tractor, so I took a deep breath and held it for a second as I got sprayed on the side of my face through my open window. Then I looked in the mirror and I got a little bit giggly because of the incident.
Does anybody have any pointers as to what this could mean? I know the bad associations with muddy waters, but this did not feel like a negative dream...
comment_text: To me it would suggest you are trying to get yoyrself out of some "muddy water" . That you had the power and strength to do so. Perhaps you even find looking back on the situation if wasn't as serious as you thought previously.

post_text:
In my dream, I was on a bus with an old friend (not a close one) of mine.. somehow or another she inhaled one of her rings through her mouth.. she wasn't upset that the ring was gone, just that it was uncomfortable for the ring to be lodged in her throat. So she yelled for the driver to stop and ran off the bus. When she was off the bus she started puking to get it out. I feel like we left her there but can't remember much after that.

This friend has on occasion messaged me awkwardly only to ghost the conversation.. and one of those occasions she said she'd had a dream that her and I were sitting around a bonfire. We hadn't talked in years before that point.

Any insight?
comment_text: Gina Marie one possibility is the ring represents the bond between the two of you. Her choking on it perhaps symbolizes her inability to follow through on being a true friend
reply_text: Terry Dey thank you. That makes a bit of sense.

post_text:
Dream 1.)guy friend had a dream that he gave me an apple which other ladies were craving for, he plucked it gave it to me and the other ladies teased and cheered for us.He rarely dreams and this was it.Is there any future happenings regarding this dream,i wonder.
Dream 2.) Recently I had a dream ,in the dream my guy friend sits on a bench next to me, it was like a classroom and the other ladies in the class were talking at my back, hatred and jealousy towards me. Anyone can interpret clearly this two dreams.
comment_text: Valerie Victory if I were to guess I would say the first dream reflects a desire to have some sort of relationship with you. I don't see it as prophetic but rather reflective. The second dream might indicate a time of waiting or pause in your life. The guy with you could have been a relationship interest but its also possible it was symbolic of a male charactistic within yourself which created or at least made you think other women might resent you for it
reply_text: Terry Dey well, i hope something good happens for the first dream as you say, for the second dream i did not have a thought that other women are resentful towards me until I had this dream, in reality he is admired by several other women who wants have a serious relationship with him and chances are like maybe they see me around him and that's what made me think if they are actually secretly jealous.I could be wrong or right.

post_text:
I’m a location dreamer. I dreamt I was in front of a majestic cathedral. Inside I saw shrines with praying statues, homeless sleeping in coffins.
Then I was standing at Lake Ontario. My parents were alive and there living together. My father was upset because my mother gives all siblings except me $1000 a month.
I was upset because my significant other stopped stooping me.
I read two books in one day.

Back in the awakened world;
I’ve been single 40 years,
the cathedral I saw in my dream is in Cologne Germany, my mother never liked me or gave anything to me let alone money we were very poor, and the Lake I called Ontario looks like Hamilton harbour on Lake Ontario which I’ve never been to or seen any photos until today.

I dream about real locations where I’ve never been and I’m not familiar with.

Does anyone else have dreams of what I can only describe as being physically maniulated/moved by an unknown entity. E.g. I once dreamed a 'demon' picked me up and threw me down my stairs, only I moved in slow motion. I've had dreams this same/similar entity/energy is lifting me up and up with their energy too. And other examples but they're hard to recall. Sometimes I feel anxious in the dream, others I'm just plain annoyed lol. One time, this was the third in a series of 3 a few years back, I shouted in its face 'COME AT ME BRO' lol!
comment_text: Demons usually represent what you think of as your "demons" or negative things about yourself you struggle with. If the demon is lifting you up or throwing you down it might be a feeling of detachment from your emotions or not taking responsibility like some unknown energy is bringing you down. More details of an actual dream involving the demon would help to figure out the meaning.

post_text: Does anyone else have dreams of what I can only describe as being physically maniulated/moved by an unknown entity. E.g. And other examples but they're hard to recall. Sometimes I feel anxious in the dream, others I'm just plain annoyed lol. One time, this was the third in a series of 3 a few years back, I shouted in its face 'COME AT ME BRO' lol!
comment_text: PS I love that you yelled Come at me Bro in a dream. 😁

post_text: I have another dream that needs interpretation. It was not my dream it was my sister's years ago. I don't know why I am thinking about it now. I have been going through some personal changes for the past couple of years, done a lot of inner work and I wonder if it's related to this dream. We are a rather large family. My grandmother had eight children and they are all close and me, and my sisters and cousins are close too. She dreamt that the whole family was boarding a plane and that I separated from the group and take another plane alone. She was very puzzled by this dream. Does someone has any idea about what it means? '
comment_text: Johanne Cazeau my guess would be that her intuition saw you as breaking away from societal norm or familial norm and heading down a different path in life.
reply_text: Terry Dey do you think it was a premonition

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thank you for letting me join

post_text: I had this weird dream where I was walking down my street. I saw two boys dressed as Ghost Face. Minus the mask first. (Scream Movies.) as I walked by I heard one boy say he wanted to kill me. Then he put his mask on. His friend/brother said I wasn't worth it Then put his mask on. They disappeared. I kept walking and came across a rodeo. I was watching the rodeo. And one of the performers was wearing a tan and red poncho. He had crutches and was getting assistance from someone to the center of the ring. Next thing I saw was it was part of the act and he was fine. I was enjoying the rodeo. Just then a little boy walked up to me said he wanted me to buy him a toy. I walked into a store and saw two women in there. (I believe they were a couple) The one woman was thanking me for finding her son. She said he ran away cause he wanted to see the rodeo. And they wanted to go shopping first. The woman introduced herself as Jessica and the other was Darla. Just then the three of them were gone. I went back out. Next thing I was back outside and this young girl ran toward me. She was saying something about these two guys were after her. She was scared and shaking. She said they are trying to kidnap her. She asked me to help hide her. I took to this abandon building that was pitch black inside. She went in and I stayed outside to fight the two guys following her.

I don’t remember much, but I had a dream I was getting pulled under water with someone. Not sure who. But under water I could feel me suffocating while being able to breath under water at the same time? I was ”breathing” while still being unable to breathe normally.
comment_text: I've had many dreams of breathing while under water. Interesting
reply_text: Lisa Sullivan it wasn’t normal human breathing either if that makes sense. It was like I was learning how to breathe under water but I wasn’t getting the big breaths I get on air so I felt like I was drowning.

post_text: I don’t remember much, but I had a dream I was getting pulled under water with someone. Not sure who. But under water I could feel me suffocating while being able to breath under water at the same time? I was ”breathing” while still being unable to breathe normally.
comment_text: Skylar Monn I would interpret this dream as feeling emotionally overwhelmed or overwhelmed with life at the time of dream. You are learning how to navigate through it.
reply_text: Terry Dey honestly, yeah. That sounds accurate.

post_text: I don’t remember much, but I had a dream I was getting pulled under water with someone. Not sure who. But under water I could feel me suffocating while being able to breath under water at the same time? I was ”breathing” while still being unable to breathe normally.
comment_text:
In addition to the excellent interpretations
here from Lisa and Terry, I would look at any health reasons.

Sometimes sleep apnea, snoring, allergies or deviated septum can cause issues with breathing at night. If you are often waking up very tired, I recommend talking to a healthcare professional like an ENT or allergist

Skylar Monn
reply_text: Nina Kaye it really felt consciously real. It was weird how vivid the lack of breaths felt.

Yup, it might be you were struggling for air as you slept... I know this feeling well.

If you wake up with a really dry or painful mouth or drool, it might indicate you have been sleeping with your mouth open because can't breathe through nose while asleep...

post_text:
It's not so much an interpretation of this dream that I'm after, but I'm curious to see if anyone has experienced similar.

I started having the dream, but then I would wake up, fall back to sleep, and the dream would continue. Not following on exactly, but more like it was a second, third, fourth and fifth episode.

The dream was about zombies. In the first episode it was children that were turning into zombies, and people were barricading themselves in their homes.

In the second episode, people were gathering together in community areas.

In the third episode, survivors were trying to get over a long bridge but were being picked off by someone with a gun.

In the fourth episode it was like the zombies were worker ants going to and from a massive house.

In the fifth episode, the survivors were in this big house trying to escape (there's no logic).

Then I woke up for good. I know I was awake for real as I got up to use the toilet or see to my son. I was falling asleep and dreaming straight away. Usually I'll have completely different dreams, not anything following on.

Anyone else had this before?
comment_text: I wont interpret as you asked me not to. But we do see lots of zombie dreams here.
reply_text: Terry Dey I am terrified of zombies. It's the one horror genre I can't watch!

post_text:
I had this dream where I was living in this big house. It was a home that a very wealthy family would have. Not a flashy like family but one that owns property and...well like Godfather meets YellowStone type of family. I was set to marry a man who was of much older age. I didn't want to. I kept running away and hiding. I would be found and brought back.
I was watched and unable to leave the house. One thing I kept doing was hiding away in this one room in the highest part of the house to just stair at this chandelier.
One part of the dream I am walking around in circle stair at this chandelier and I see my reflection of me. I am looking how I am not all skinny skinny but I have lost weight and I am satisfied with how my body looks. Slim but thick. And then I look at the chandelier. I go down to the kitchen and all the older women who my mom, grandmother are telling me to stop fussing about the wedding. But I know the man they are having me marry is an older and very fat man. Who I don't know at all.
So I run again up to the room and just watch the chandelier. I just want to watch the chandelier and when I close my eyes another man comes to mind but I don't fully see him. I feel him and it feels like the man that I have been in love with for the past few years in real life. But I don't see anyone...just feel them and I keep walking around in circles or sitting and gazing at the chandelier.
comment_text: Jasmine Marie I would interpret this dream as two potential future scenarios you see internally. One is a future that seems dependable, expected (perhaps by family), and would seem from the outside like the path of wisdom. But internally you are focused on different path. A brightness and destination that resonates more strongly within you. You are focused in the dream on following your own path....not the one you are expected in life to take.

post_text: New member here. I got one for y'all that you may have never heard of. I have a recurring dream that i live in a house with terrible bathroom issues. Everytime the toilet is flushed, it overflows and floods the whole bathroom, water will also bubble up from the sink and tub to the point that the whole house floods! It sounds silly I know, but i have this dream often. Any ideas of what it could mean?
comment_text: Ooh I have a recurring dream like this. I did post about it on here so if you wanted to search for it, you might get a bit of insight.

post_text: New member here. I got one for y'all that you may have never heard of. I have a recurring dream that i live in a house with terrible bathroom issues. Everytime the toilet is flushed, it overflows and floods the whole bathroom, water will also bubble up from the sink and tub to the point that the whole house floods! It sounds silly I know, but i have this dream often. Any ideas of what it could mean?
comment_text: Lisa Sullivan we do get lots of bathroom/dirty toilets dreams so you're not alone. One interpretation would be that you are dealing with alot of toxic emotional issues in your life and you are having difficutly getting rid of them. There is a negativity in your life you are trying to cleanse yourself of and it hasnt been easy

post_text: I was walking a long road and was very tired. I ended in a place that seems to welcome travelers. I fell asleep and when I woke up, there was a nurse on my bedside. She was holding a baby. She told me I gave birth in my sleep and that I was very agitated while giving birth to the baby. I took the baby in my arm and saw that she was very lively and had incredibly beautiful, large and shiny eyes. Can someone help me interpret this dream? I don't have children and I don't want any. I feel this dream is not about wanting children but I can't figure out the meaning.
comment_text: Johanne Cazeau I would interpret this dream as a readiness for change in your life. There is a new aspect of your life being readied. That could be personal change, work related, or relationship related
reply_text: Terry Dey thank you. it resonates with me.

post_text: I don't remember the dream all I remember is seeing a very bright light at the end of what seemed like a tunnel. Then In real life I was woke up at 1:54 am by something and when I looked over a dark figure was next to my bed and I felt very anxious.
comment_text: Light a candle

post_text: I don't remember the dream all I remember is seeing a very bright light at the end of what seemed like a tunnel. Then In real life I was woke up at 1:54 am by something and when I looked over a dark figure was next to my bed and I felt very anxious.
comment_text: Alicia Lintner without the dream its hard to say for sure how the tunnel or figure connects. But hopefully you'll get some guesses

post_text: I had a dream about this lady who looked like this blues singer she was about to let me do her make up but she took my make up and let someone else did it but I can tell something. Was wrong with this lady she was strange I asked her could she get us something to eat n when I asked that. All stuff started to be off her eyes went in the back of her head and stuff it was a scary dream my son and little nicec was in the house and the house got caught on 🔥 my grandma bf was still there but he was asleep and didn't wake up and that's not him it was really scary and when she came by the stairs she looked down and laughed at us when my lil nicec lady shirt got attached with the fire. What was that dream about I hope noun of the dreams don't come true cause some of them do
comment_text: The blues singer most likely represents that you’re not happy about something, whatever was bothering you that day. Makeup can mean wanting to put a good face on it, to feel better. Getting something to eat could mean you feel a hunger/desire that isn’t being satisfied. She’s representing that it seems strange and you don’t like it, you’re not comfortable. The house being caught on fire could mean you’re burning up about it, feeling angry. The grandmas bf could be representing some wise action to take, but since he’s asleep and can’t wake up, it represents you feel you don’t know what to do about it, what wise action to take.

post_text: What does it mean when you have a dream about a real cannibal that died in the 90s and in the dream you cut off his head and put it in a freezer bag filled with water
comment_text:
It means you were “ahead” of the game, and already knew water prolonged the inevitable freezer burn.
But on the logical side, no clue, still, following your post since the legit response has got to be good.

post_text: What does it mean when you have a dream about a real cannibal that died in the 90s and in the dream you cut off his head and put it in a freezer bag filled with water
comment_text:
To me, the dream seems to be symbolizing the severing of a certain "anchorage" you have in the fear/death shadow that we all carry as humans.

You saw someone who was a murderer in real life. I know I'm terrified of Humans because of how unbelievably brutal we can be. This shadow anchorage of mine says to me "OMG he's human I'm human what drove him to this could I have the same SEED in me??" and I shudder because it's a terrifying thought. I believe that's what played out in your dream.

Had it been a person you knew in real life, I believe the meaning would be very different (you'd have been slaying some patriarchal anchorages).

You seem to be symbolically slaying a FEAR anchorage that you have in an aspect of the Human psyche (our collective fear/death shadow).

When you put the Head in a bag filled with water, to me it means you're willing to "integrate" this shadow now, you're willing to let it immerse without remaining an anchorage you "draw" from and "feed" simultaneously,
ie you'll grow out of certain fears that connect to the most brutal aspects of the Human psyche.

This will happen as part of your spiritual ascension onto the next "phase" for your specific ascension path.

post_text: What does it mean when you have a dream about a real cannibal that died in the 90s and in the dream you cut off his head and put it in a freezer bag filled with water

reply_text:
Sinqobile Ngwenya Time to expand your thinking about many things. Your current thinking may be too small for you to live with currently, and comfortably. You are outgrowing your life situation.

Also, there is far more to you than you know.

I dreamt playing casino. I won many free slots. The casino machine showed me beautiful colours. I kept winning money until it displayed 777 and I was told I won R400 000 which was all of the money in the machine.

post_text:
i’ve had a dream 3 nights in a row about a baby girl, the first one my little brother was in the computer designing a room for my older brother and my little brother asked me to come see if it was good so i go and look and i said it needs a tv also why is there two kids beds in here and my mum said that my brother is gonna have a baby and my mums gonna help look after it.

the next night i had a dream where my mum was holding a baby girl and i said who’s baby is that and she gave it to me and said it’s your brothers and i was like “i knew he was gonna have a baby because i had a dream that my little brother was designing a room and there were two kids beds in there” like what?? i ￼ referenced a dream in a dream!!

and then the next night i had a dream and there was a baby girl in it again
comment_text: Jaimee Connor while its possible your psychic self has picked up on a new arrival the baby girl might also symbolize you. Your desire for nurturing or to be cared for. Possibly your sensitive or vulnerable side (if you've felt under attack recently)

post_text:
Last night I had a dream about a coworker ( who irl has a crush on me). He approached me with a smile, although I always ignore him at work. When he tried to touch me I snapped and cussed at him and told him I don't like his personality.The next thing I see in a dream him asking others who exposed his true nature to me.

In real life this coworker is always around me, even asked me out which I refused. He's known to be the good guy by other coworkers but something in him just didn't sit right with me.
comment_text: Ana Kulić I think the dream is simply reflecting the questions and doubts you have towards this person. It seems like your mind is processing how you feel towards him

post_text:
So many, many years ago when I moved out of my family's house. I rented a room and went to college. I became close to the family especially their grandson who was 18 at the time. Fast forward, I moved out, we lost tough, found each other lost again and found again. This went on for years. We have been in touch for the past 5 years due to social media. He turned into a quite, nasty, grumpy old man...nothing like the cute fun kid from the 70's.
I dreamt that we had a disagreement over the phone and
I wanted to or had to give him back they key to his Grandparents house. They've been gone well over 45 years and the house was sold.
Any idea what this could mean?
comment_text: Are you feeling grumpy about anything from the past?
reply_text:
Rita Catherine
Always 🤣

post_text:
Last night in my dream I was house sitting for a family member. I walked to the house, which was actually a long walk, along a dirt path. Ahead of me was a deer chasing a grizzly bear. My walking speed matched their running speed.
I entered the house and started turning on lights as it was getting dark quickly. I went to the back door to find a black bear napping in what looked like a large mud room. The pets inside the house were all panicking.
I tried to secure the house but the black bear found a way in through a door I didn't know about.
I ran to the basement to find several family members watching television. When I told them a bear was in the house they panicked.
I went back upstairs, grabbed the bear by the scruff of his neck and dragged it outside.

It was all so surreal I laughed a little when I woke up.
comment_text: It could be about dealing with a problem that found its way in. Since you’re house sitting it could be you’re thinking about a family problem rather than it being your specific problem.

post_text: I need advice. I've have extremely vivid dreams for about a good 10 years now. Dreams about what happens after we die, biblical and religious dreams even though I've never really even been to church. I've learned to regonize at times that im dreaming and have a bit more control and learned to listen and really interpret what I'm seeing and feeling. I've always felt in control. But last night was so different. I was dreaming as usual and I knew I was dreaming just nonsense release sort of dream. Then for no reason at all I'm at my house but it's in real time. Like I'm awake but still asleep. I seriously can't decipher if I'm awake or dreaming. I'm then on my back porch and I'm looking to the right, into the yard and all the sudden I turn to the left and there is a older native american woman right in my face and she (best I can describe it) kicked me out of my own dream. I felt myself being thrown back into my body with such force. She scared me so bad I'm sitting here at almost 11 pm scared to sleep because that's all I can see or think about. I'm actually very scared to sleep.
comment_text: It might have been an astral projection, they can be hard to control.

post_text: What does it mean when you dream about other people taking pictures of you?￼
comment_text:
Hi Aolani, this could mean a number of things. More information to the dream would really help for a clearer interpretation.
Just one thought, are you looking for more privacy. You could be trying to make a good impression to others.

post_text: What does it mean when you dream about other people taking pictures of you?￼
comment_text: Also, having your picture taken could be an invite from the dream to look at something about your self objectively. From the neutral perspective of other rather than our subjective filter.

post_text:
Had a very vivid/weird dream last night.
Started off with being near the beach with my OH and watching large boulders being dropped into the sea, which we thought were bombs.

Next thing I know, I'm on a ship, something similar to a cargo ship. Something bad happened and we all had to evacuate, but we (the other people on the boat, not my OH as he wasn't there) missed the last flight off.

Suddenly there was ice everywhere and we were all trapped on a set of metal stairs leading up to the flight deck. It was freezing and we couldn't move. I began to sob hysterically and dropped to the floor that was icy cold.
I wanted to die and get it over with, so much that I almost jumped from the railing but was stopped by a random guy.

The rest is blurry after that. I remember being comforted, but not sure by who.

Any thoughts?
comment_text:
Hi, the dream suggests you ard trying to navigate some difficukt emotions.

There is a situation that you feel could be devastating and explosive but actually is less volatile than you imagine. Though It still causes major emotional disruption and obstacles in your life.

My thoughts are that you feel very vulnerable as you try to navigate the repercussions of this event, you would like to escape but you are unable.

I feel the ice represents frozen emotions. A feeling of being stuck and unable to find releif or release. You would like to move on or make changes but you are potentially afraid I feel. You perhaps are unable to let your true feeling be known. I wonder if this is related to yoyr relationship in some way. I feel internally you are being overwhelmed by your emotions, you want the situation to end but you feel unable to act, and this is very difficult for you. I feel the random man is your own thinking/
rational side who is trying to support you as right now the emotional side is overworked. I feel the dream calls for balance in order to find some resolution, dealing with this situation through emotions alone is exhausting you, to me it seems it's time to get some perspective, look at things in a more logical way and make some decissions based on reason as well as feelings.
reply_text: Alexandra Moulding thank you 😊

post_text:
I have a friend that has occurring dreams for years that he is stuck in a loop taking left turns. These types of dreams are quite scary and really bothers him while it’s happening. He is aware that it is a dream while in it but cannot get out of them for quite some time…

Any ideas for what it could mean? And any ideas for how to get out of this type of looping dream?

Would also mention that he works as a programmer… which I read in a post in a forum might have something to do with it…
comment_text: Hi Emilee, because your friends dream is occurring, this could mean they are not paying attention to something or facing up to something which could help them to move on. You say they are stuck in a loop and keeps turning left. So I see this as facing up to a fear which would in turn help them to move in different directions and move forward from this.

post_text: Had a dream that I was pregnant by the man I am in love with. Everyone was happy but I was skeptical. I knew in my mind it wasn't really happening. That it was a dream. My belly was swollen with a baby but I kept wondering if it was real, he walked in on me sitting a my vanity getting my hair done. He looked at me afraid and worried. I couldn't look at him cause I kept thinking he didn't love me. That it wasn't real...I always dream of him to love me but in this dream I was afraid. But I kept holding my belly, cradling it but still hard to believe that he loved me. More than anything I want his love, freely and willingly.
comment_text: I feel the dream is symbolic of new feelings regarding this man that are developing within you. I feel that you are beginning to understand that the things you fantasize about are not real. I feel the image of you sitting at your vanity is asking you to reflect on things, on yourself and your feelings about him. My thoughts, and others may differ, is that the drwam suggests you are beginning to wonder if what you wish for is really just a dream.

post_text: Had a dream that I was pregnant by the man I am in love with. Everyone was happy but I was skeptical. I knew in my mind it wasn't really happening. That it was a dream. My belly was swollen with a baby but I kept wondering if it was real, he walked in on me sitting a my vanity getting my hair done. He looked at me afraid and worried. I couldn't look at him cause I kept thinking he didn't love me. That it wasn't real...I always dream of him to love me but in this dream I was afraid. But I kept holding my belly, cradling it but still hard to believe that he loved me. More than anything I want his love, freely and willingly.
comment_text: Alexandra Moulding question. In the dream I was sitting to the side. There was no mirror from what I recall but I was sitting sideways towards the door. He was standing there looking at me afraid I was going to leave. I could feel that he wanted me to feel that love but again I was cradling my belly and feeling afraid, unsure. Had that piece of the dream again.
reply_text: Jasmine Marie of course there are many ways of interpreting dreams but my own thoughts are that the dream is created by you And can only reflect your own thoughts and feelings. Its not possible for the dream to navigate another persons potential thpughts or fedlings only jow you perceive them. In my method everyone represents an aspect of yourself so it suggests that you are afraid afraid in some way and wish there could be love between you. Just an idea though, others might offer an alternative.

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.
