post_text: I had 4 false awakenings after taking a nap today. On the 4th one, there was a woman in my living room beside me (I was asleep on the couch) and she got up and started heading to the door like she was leaving, I was like "WHO THE FUCK ARE YOU?!" And she looked at me and said "Grandma". My grandma is passed away, but she was not MY grandma and I said this. She appeared to be an old native American woman (I am also native), she didn't smile and I was immediately afraid of her. I kept trying to turn the lamp on so I could see her better. The light wouldn't turn on which made me realize it was a dream (or maybe astral projection) because lights never work in my dreams and that's how I always become lucid and know I'm dreaming. Then she said "I'm not going to let you turn the light on". I started freaking out because I couldn't wake myself up and she started attacking me. I finally forced myself awake, but I kept slipping back into the dream because I couldnt hold my eyes open, and every time I did she was still attacking me. There was someone else in the room at one point that I couldn't see, whispering "She let someone in when she was staring in the mirror", and I was screaming "WHO DID?!" but they wouldn't answer. Eventually I woke up all the way, but does anyone know what this could mean?
comment_text:
As I see it, she represents two things, one being ancestral trauma pertaining to your grandmother. When she says she won't let you turn the light on, that's shadow-speak for "I won't let you kill me" as "shadow-work" is about shedding Divine Light on trauma shadows to "heal" them. Traumas hide in the shadows, they are the shadows..

Find out a bit about her younger days for specific traumas. If there aren't any major traumas you can identify then she could be representing "Anchorages" into old Feminine psyche, old Feminine values, old Feminine energies that you're growing out of as a natural part of life.

Either way, the shadows we shed Light on and grow out of, feel we're attacking and murdering them so they "attack" us and scare us but they can't actually do anything besides creating fear which they then latch on to and survive through. They're just shadows, they work through perception, illusion, "Magic".

My suggestion would be energy cleansing using Earthing/
Grounding and increasing water intake (I always suggest these two for a smoother ascension as we're all experiencing ascension symptoms globally).

I'd highly recommend the scents of rose, jasmine, and sandalwood around you.

Send healing and love to the vision you saw. She told you she was your grandmother so you'd know the thread that connects her to you, so you'd know whom to send Love and Light to.

Focus on strengthening your Heart Chakra. All Chakras spin and as they spin they "cleanse". Cleansing is transmuting because energy doesn't go anywhere it transmutes into other forms of energy.

When we divert focus to the Chakras during meditation, they are energized. Energized Chakras cleanse better even on autopilot ie when you're not meditating.

Cleansed Chakras mean stronger spiritual boundaries which means greater "protection".
reply_text: Thank you so much for this lengthy and thought out explanation. I will ask my mother about my grandma's life and see if she has any answers to any of it. I was really, really close to my grandma but we didn't ever talk much about her childhood. I remember trying to dig my nails into the dream grandma's arm to try to get her off me but nothing worked. Your explanation hits so close to home and I'll meditate on this tomorrow for a while. I do drink at least a gallon a day of water (my friends make fun of me and call me a fish lol) and I wear a few crystals but I will look into all of your suggestions. I truly appreciate you taking the time and energy to respond, thabk you so much.

reply_text:
So I have certain patterns with these specific types of dreams, which I consider astral projections, that I've noticed, so I usually sleep within specific parameters to avoid stuff like this. When I sleep before bed, I smoke weed. Regardless of what I do before bed, the weed keeps me from dreaming, with the exception of waking up at some point and going back to sleep, which leads to extremely vivid lucid dreaming/
astral projection. Similarly, this was a nap, and when I take a nap before work, I don't smoke beforehand so I *always* have vivid lucid dreams/AP. Sometimes I take naps solely because of this with the intention of connecting spiritually. This wasn't that, though, I literally just dozed off on my couch and that sometimes leads to "waking up" in the same room, with some differences, sometimes several times. There is almost never another person and I freak out when there is.

Things they all have in common:

1. It's always night time. I have windows in my house that let in lots of sun, but it's always night, even if it's light outside in waking life. This is actually true of all my dreams, not just the ones like this.

2. The lights are off in the house but I can still see. The light and lamp switches not working is what makes me become lucid if something else hasn't already done so.

3. I am usually alone, because i live alone, and if it's a nap before work, when I "wake up", I go about what I would normally do when I woke up from a nap, like get ready for work, makeup, etc. until something triggers me to realize I'm dreaming. A few times, I was a half hour into my work night before it came to me. I work at night so sometimes it took me longer to question my surroundings. I was pretty annoyed every time I had to do it all over again.

4. Everything is exactly the same until it isn't. During false awakenings, I wake up exactly where I am, over and over and it feels so real. I have a theory on this and dimension/
timeline alterations, especially because...

..5. These are way harder to wake up from than any other type of dream. With other dreams, I wake up fully right away and start to forget small details little by little. With these dreams, I have to actively fight HARD to get my eyelids to open because if they're closed I will slip back in, but it's like a magnet is pulling them shut and and I'm fighting against it. It makes me start to panic because I can't wake myself up. I mean, it's hard as hell, and I lose over and over until I finally win and I'm so tired the rest of the day I also don't forget them the same way. I remember all of my dreams to a degree, but these are vivid like memories. I'm in the same room now and its making me uncomfortable thinking about it.

This is what the false awakening/AP dreams have in common, I have other experiences, like night terrors, and not being able to talk/yell/
scream which makes me cry and I actually am crying/hoarse when I wake up, hearing a word shouted at me as I wake up, someone yelling my name, etc. but idk if they're related to this. I once had something yell "wake up" and snap me out of my sleep. I left the room and insisted my dog come with me just due to a feeling and less than 3 minutes later, my entire bedroom ceiling fell in right where I was sleeping. I'm no stranger to odd sleep occurances and spiritual experiences, but this dream stood out to me simply because there were other people present and the things they said. I'm not used to anyone else being there in these types of dreams specifically, so it's messing with me. I will try your suggestions, and thank you so much for responding!

post_text: I had 4 false awakenings after taking a nap today. On the 4th one, there was a woman in my living room beside me (I was asleep on the couch) and she got up and started heading to the door like she was leaving, I was like "WHO THE FUCK ARE YOU?!" And she looked at me and said "Grandma". My grandma is passed away, but she was not MY grandma and I said this. She appeared to be an old native American woman (I am also native), she didn't smile and I was immediately afraid of her. I kept trying to turn the lamp on so I could see her better. The light wouldn't turn on which made me realize it was a dream (or maybe astral projection) because lights never work in my dreams and that's how I always become lucid and know I'm dreaming. Then she said "I'm not going to let you turn the light on". I started freaking out because I couldn't wake myself up and she started attacking me. I finally forced myself awake, but I kept slipping back into the dream because I couldnt hold my eyes open, and every time I did she was still attacking me. There was someone else in the room at one point that I couldn't see, whispering "She let someone in when she was staring in the mirror", and I was screaming "WHO DID?!" but they wouldn't answer. Eventually I woke up all the way, but does anyone know what this could mean?
comment_text:
Have you debunked other things like no sugar before bed? Practicing reflection at the end of the day? Relaxation techniques before bed? Repressed emotions or feelings being triggered?

To me it seems like there was something actually happening, and something spiritual as well. Like both your Sleeping self and awake self were both "Active" which might explain why you felt you were going in and out of Consciousness but still conscious in waking and sleeping state.

But it could also be a night terror that really acted on your reflexes and fight or flight response.

I am native as well, I recommend Bitter Root with lemon and honey tea before bed. A hot bath with cedar leaves. And wash your hair with sage after normal washing

You could also try to see a native healer. But I think this could also be partly a night terror for you as well and acts on your reflexes a lot. Otherwise you would be waking up with scratches on your body or your environment is disrupted like a dent in the wall or pillows thrown across the room. That's what usually happens during a ghost spiritual attack. Most ghosts or spirits will attack physically instead of just scaring you. This can also happen with someone who has active Rapid Eye movements during sleep, and is also a heavy sleeper. I think sometimes your own fears might turn the storyline in your dream state as well. That's just the other stuff I'm getting. That is mostly some kind of night terror with Rapid Eye movements and heavy sleep. Which can make you feel paralyzed in sleep or sometimes makes you feel trapped in your own body. It's just something to consider.

Also, if the same dream keeps repeating then it could be something that you need to deal with or havent dealt with properly. And for hearing screams, do you normally have sensitivity to sounds? Like if a horn was blown, it feels like someone stabbing a knife on your ear? It could also you picking up distance sounds whole you sleep and your brain utilizes the sounds. Or you might have a squeaky house too. But it could also mean that your brain is acting on a fear as well, and everything is combined into one dream salad.

Or having those items on stock so that you can use them when you need them.

post_text: Okay this one might be a little everywhere. So it started out as me figuring out that my “best friend” in the dream was talking to my boyfriend of almost three years. I’m always either super angry or crying hysterically, this time I was crying hysterically. So when they decided to meet up I went outside and sat in his car with him just to never get answers. (In any dream he cheats I never get answers or it’s always my fault) so after I get no answers and leave, someone’s driving to my house and I’m crying really bad and I look in the back seat to like the “dream best friend” and I ask her how could she do this knowing me and him been together for three years! And I started smacking tf out of her. We get to my house and my brother falls for her the same brother that said me dating someone older is bad for the family (and he has a controlling gf) and there he is trying to get with someone younger that has the same age gap. Then I starting screaming and popping off to my brother saying like tf how is he gonna be so hypocritical! And one part of the dream I remember is calling my boyfriends phone and a girl￼ picks up and I tell her she better find my boyfriend before I drive up to his town my self and she found him and he headed to my house ig to talk but he never tells me why he did it in my dreams unless it’s blaming me. The rest of the dream was me following my boyfriend around to get answers because he’s always running, or always finding a way out of it.
comment_text: Ooof, dreams like that really eff up your day afterwards…To me this sounds like a fear of loss or betrayal. Since it deals with several people I’d say you might be feeling disconnected from your loved ones, which could contribute to fears of being blindsided or betrayed. Maybe communication isn’t as open or frequent as you desire, or on the flip side this can happen from the opposite. When things are going realllly well we tend to think “ok, where’s the catch? what could threaten this good thing I’ve got going?”. I’d say you should take a day with each person involved. Plan some fun actives, or just hang out and talk. Confiding in each other about your lives, worries, and feelings might restore the sense of security and trust. Take a little time and mull over the events, patterns, or fears that could be making you feel far away from the people you love. Could be as simple as not having adequate time to catch up with people and maintain that feeling of an intimate connection. Good luck, I hope you feel better soon 💕
reply_text: Emily Ireland thanks for your insight and yes it did start my day off a bit shaky but I’m always tired of crying in my dreams. I wonder if I can do something before bed to induce good dreams

reply_text:
Alycia Ziegler welllll, I don’t know what you have or haven’t tried already, but I have some ideas if you’d like…. Firstly, there are guided meditations/
lucid dreaming tutorials on YouTube. That might help prompt better dreams, or at least give you some control over the bad ones. With time and effort you can probably teach yourself to recognize when you are dreaming, and possibly even wake yourself up. A lot of people have at least moderate success with that.

Daydreaming about something really interesting and positive before sleep can help.

THIS is weird ass tip, but it works for me as a memory trick, and for dreams too, so I’ll put it out there on the chance that it helps. I hold onto one of my earrings while thinking intently about what I want to remember or dream about, picture putting that thought into the earring, and imagine that it goes into your ear/brain as you sleep. It’s bizarre, but worth a shot.

If you haven’t tried it already, pillow sprays and aroma therapy can be really soothing.

Some other things to consider would be certain foods or drinks before bed. chocolate, melatonin, caffeine, spicy or fermented foods can all cause hellish nightmares. Being too hot or cold in the night can trigger some nasty dreams too. Milk, cherries, and turkey can all help aid in getting to sleep, but I don’t know how or if they affect dreams.

Music or relaxing sounds might help, and working out or stretching a few hours before bed can also help sometimes.
I’ve also heard of a lot of folks keeping dream journals. It can help process thoughts so they don’t keep coming back up in your sleep.

Sorry for the long ass reply, hopefully some of those ideas help.. I know chronic nightmares are emotionally draining and upsetting to deal with, I hope you’re able to get some peace and good rest

post_text:
I am in an underground activity, like an escape room but on a larger scale, like a labyrinth. There are lots of people walking around trying to find the way out, but getting nowhere. One of them is an old dancing partner when I was taking ballroom dancing lessons.

I get the impression of a long time searching for the proper path.

The focus of the dream is when I come to an old temple, Ancient Greek-ish with a large granite statue, specifically granite with a rustic pinkish hue.

Looking up into the temple roof I realise no one is up there and it dawns on me that the path is likely up there as no one down here has found the way, so I head up there.

The dream then goes to an out of body view of the path. There is an above ground bridge like structure, and the way corkscrews as a tunnel around it. Because its a tunnel everyone assumes its underground, but it isn't, its not logical. That's the trick.
comment_text: This dream represents your life. You and others are in this labyrinth which represents a safe place but also a trap sort of. If you want to play it safe in life you are stuck in the labyrinth. You are searching for a way out and the temple you realize is the way out. The knowledge from the past gives you the opportunity to learn more about your path forward in life. You see beyond the labyrinth. That it's really an illusion. The true path is finding a way to be above it all. To not stay down in the labyrinth. To take the higher road is the answer.
reply_text: Lovely ❤

comment_text:
The subconscious here in the subterranean can mean both the shadow or unexplored self, which turns into impulse if we are not aware of it, and also the subsistence level mindset or even a survivalist mindset, where we react to life instead of choosing things in life. This happens if we have a bunch of unresolved issues or trauma that bogs us down, and we find ourselves defensive or triggered often by daily occurences, we cannot respond to these with openness or full responsiveness,
because we have shut ourselves down due to the fight, flight or freeze reaction. (I more and more think that the key to unconscious/
consciousness exploration is linked with parasympathetic
nervous system response. And that neuroscience is finding out what religion has said for a long time - that love is consciousness, the higher path, awareness.... it is only when we feel the safety of being loved that we can actually open our awareness with our higher faculties...)

And so many are stuck in this trap. Or puzzle or maze like an escape room. It is like a trap, because interestingly, we cannot truly figure out this unconscious reactivity this defensive triggered survival mode while we are actually in it. Neuroscience is saying this too. That you feel safe again first. THEN look at understanding the trigger.

But first, get out of the hole you are in, to see from a wider perspective.

Often, we get trapped in the survivalist mode because we try to figure it out from within that survivalist mode. For example, someone who feels triggered by another's behaviour might then identify that behaviour as the cause of the trigger. But this doesn't actually go very far in understanding, overcoming, or resolution. It merely cements the knowledge that the world is unsafe and that we have to have our defenses up instead of trying to find common ground.

The tunnels I think are a metaphor similar to the "trances" they often talk about in the new age (and sometimes psychology). The auto pilot mode, that is living unconsciously, without conscious awareness and choice making.

"Tunnel vision" is seeing only the narrowest path in front of you and no way out. This can be like depression "a long dark tunnel". Tunneling into something also in a more positive way can be about obsessive focus on figuring out the originating path of some particular behavioural pattern. Sometimes I think we do have to delve deeply into an obsessive thought on a specific topic in order to understand that pattern in our life. But, as in your dream, the idea is to recall you are not just in a negative obsessive circular thought pattern. But that instead you are "tunneling" up and out, in order to find the secret way to unlock this particular unconscious behavioural pattern, to crack the code, to be able to stop unconsciously repeating it.

I'll come back to the temple and the statue...

comment_text:
Oh. And how you are there with many other people trapped in this underground, and one is former dance partner...

Dance here can also be synonymous with that "trance" metaphor. Here, the struggle to find meaning of the unconscious while staying submerged in the unconscious.

"I was never good at that dance anyway, I gave it up when I had a family"

The defensive survivalist mode was never appealing for you to be stuck in, and having a family moved you further out of that.

Which makes sense to me. To consciously choose to have a family, it requires a huuuuuggggee amount of hope and faith and optimism. AND a longer view. AND a broader understanding of the self, knowing that the lower self for example immediate needs is not the whole self, which allows one to have more patience and delayed gratification, more giving. Because you can think of not just the immediate self, but also the past and future selves, a very expansive view of self that takes us out of immediate reactivity and makes us look at a wider overview.

Also though, the larger view of self and how that links with starting a family is the selfless love of having a family. That our wellbeing is now so palpably connected to ensuring the wellbeing of our family. It is a reminder we are not just alone, selfishness is very very narrow of a view. People are quite interconnected,
whether we can see that overview or not.

Greek temple and statue could be Agape love.

Pink is often a sign of love. And the unnamed god is "openhanded"

Agape love, universal love, what is termed also "christian charity", selfless love, a larger view of self, caring for others, "gods love"...

As I said above, I think neuroscience (for example Stephen Porges polyvagal theory) is just telling us now what ancient religion and philosophy has also said. Agape love is the answer to consciousness. Giving it and receiving it opens the pathways.

Pathways here also are figurative, as in changing behavioural patterns in life through increasing overview and wider awareness. But also literal - opening and strengthening new pathways in the brain to form connections that used to be dead ends or circular thought patterns before.

Agape love, which I think is necessary in consciously starting a family, is linked with hope, faith, optimism, and it is definitely the guiding philosophical principle which can improve life for oneself and others 💙

post_text:
I am in an underground activity, like an escape room but on a larger scale, like a labyrinth. There are lots of people walking around trying to find the way out, but getting nowhere. One of them is an old dancing partner when I was taking ballroom dancing lessons.

I get the impression of a long time searching for the proper path.

The focus of the dream is when I come to an old temple, Ancient Greek-ish with a large granite statue, specifically granite with a rustic pinkish hue.

Looking up into the temple roof I realise no one is up there and it dawns on me that the path is likely up there as no one down here has found the way, so I head up there.

The dream then goes to an out of body view of the path. There is an above ground bridge like structure, and the way corkscrews as a tunnel around it. Because its a tunnel everyone assumes its underground, but it isn't, its not logical. That's the trick.

post_text:
*graphic natured dream*

Okay so I only remember bits and pieces… but why would I dream I accidentally killed someone??? 😳😳😳 I remember my brother (he has stolen from me and everyone in the past) but he was in my room with the light off and I caught him and we were arguing and he said he was going to tell my boyfriend I was cheating on him, then I can remember my ex at my door with my younger brother. Well in the doorway my other brother (the one in my room) tried to choke me and I pushed him he fell off my porch but then completely changed from my dark head brother to some unknown blonde guy. His neck was broken and he was dead. I was screaming it was an accident, I was hysterically crying. Thank God I woke up fast from that horrible dream, but what the hell????
comment_text:
Unresolved issues with your brother are probably contributing. Your mind may have been trying to tell you that you need to cut him out of your life, or let it go. The reason he may have changed to a different person in the end could be that you don't really want to hurt your brother at all, just the part of him that is doing bad and irresponsible things. That person could represent someone who has influenced or encouraged his negative behaviors in the past.

I'm so sorry you had such a horrible dream. It's scary when your subconscious shows you images you would never actually do in real life, but remember our dreams typically are not literal. It's all imagery and symbolism interpreted from memories and experiences in our past. I hope your dreams are better from now on. 💚
reply_text: Julz Marie Waid thank you so much for you’re response!! I hope my dreams still good, usually I dream of my passed ex. He was my sons father and my best friend. Our son also passed away.

post_text:
The other night I had an awesome dream.

I wasn’t myself in this dream, I was a small, translucent, slime ball lol. I was super bouncy and could just bounce all over the place

The scene of the dream was like a video game level, I was contained in a giant cube-like area, and it was full of beautiful bright colors like purple, magenta, teal, and white. Super happy looking. There were tall platforms for me to jump onto and certain areas had little trampolines which would make me jump even higher.

In this it was exactly like a video game, I was trying to hop away from the enemy chasing me, I was having so much fun even though I was a bit scared to get caught! In order to stay ahead, I had to try to jump on the trampolines only so I could jump faster and higher each time. At one point I accidentally landed on flat tile (looked like bathroom tile, it was shiny and cold and I still remember how it felt landing on it) and I sort of just splatted on it and didn’t bounce. I had to shimmy my way back to the trampolines to bounce again, I was super close to getting caught by the enemy, but still got away!

I have no idea what this dream could mean 😂 it was sure fun
comment_text: Hi Sarah, what a wonderful dream. My first thought is your dream could be looking at you building on your resilience. You could have taken on another role in your life which have given you some challenges which you are loving. This could be building on your own strength and confidence which in turn is allowing you to be in a good place within your life.

post_text: Hello! I am seeking insight into my dream. I dreamt that it was night. I was sitting on the passenger side of a vehicle that was parked in front of a house that was recently purchased by someone I knew in my dream. It appeared to be a really nice move-in ready home, however, upon close examination, I could tell that the home was not habitable. The roof was incomplete as I could still see its trusses. It was evident that the home had been assembled quickly without regard. There was a non-occupant vehicle parked next to the vehicle that I was in. Despite the vehicle being new, there were visible scratches. Suddenly, the vehicle that I was in started to roll backwards. I struggled to stop the vehicle, but managed to figure it just moments prior to it rolling in the street . The vehicle's interior was quiet unique, and not at all what I am accustomed to. I couldn't figure out how to drive the vehicle forward towards the house. My husband came along to explain a few things about the vehicle. The dream changed and I was now sitting in the rear. There was a woman sitting in the driver's seat. Without warning the woman transformed into a dark green lizard. I was so frightened that I ran out of the vehicle. I started swimming through the air (a common occurrence in my dreams). Afraid that someone would see me, I sought-after a place that I could swim through the air without being seen.
comment_text: It seems in this dream that you are out of your league. You have a car that you don't understand how to drive. You have a house that you can't live in. You are trying to do too much. This dream is saying to slow down and not get ahead of yourself.
reply_text: Roy De Ruyter thank you for your help. The house nor car actually belonged to me in the dream. Anyhow, I feel that this dream is about a possible upcoming move. I reside in Arizona, USA and I believe that my time here has come to an end. It has turned into California ... overpriced and overpopulated. The water supply is also a huge issue here as well. I've attempted to make living here work, however, it seems beyond my control. I feel that I am being pushed out due to the circumstances. The other state that I am considering is much more affordable and far less populated. Despite this, the state as a whole appears quite underwhelming. It's lacking major appeal! I believe the new car with the scratches symbolizes that particular state, and the car that I cannot control symbolizes Arizona. Sincerely, I do not have many options to remain where I am. I am uncertain as to what the lizard represents, however, it must mean something.

post_text: Hello everyone. I had a dream I was following a line that lead to an asylum. When I realized what the line lead to I tried to get off the line but it was too late. I was already inside the building and the guards weren’t letting me out. They told me to speak to someone inside. It was like grand central station. I saw the daughter of my old neighbor and she was tall. When I recognized her, I gave her a big hug and asked what she was doing there and she said her sisters were lying on her. Then I started pulling out keys and wallets that didn’t belong to me out of my pockets. My neighbor’s daughter had set me up. I’m trying to explain to everyone that I am not crazy. Then I woke up in a room with a bunch of other women lying on mattresses on the floor. I was barefoot and my phone was broken. But the only thing I thought of was my boyfriend and how he would never believe what happened to me. He would believe I was cheating on him. I called him and I’m crying on my broken phone, walking barefoot and 1/2 naked. I tell him what happened and asked him to come pick me up and he said “I can’t, I’m watching tik toks” 🤔🤔🤔🤔 and that’s all I remember. 🤦🏻‍♀️. Is there a deep meaning to this dream? Thank you for your time 🙏

reply_text:
Carmen Montanez

I'm grateful for the opportunity 🙂🙏💛💛💛

I have read it as a very beautiful and deeply spiritual dream narrating to me a story of a girl on a journey of Love and Madness. This Mad Love is the Self (Soul, Christ Consciousness) coming through. This Madness carries with it the trauma of all Madmen who have ever spilled pearls before swine and then faced the consequences of doing that. Within our minds we all carry a very deep rooted fear of "exposure".

This fear is a shadow blocking our inner Light.

Carl Jung never believed madness was madness. Christ Consciousness is Mad Divine Love channeling through a Human body. That's it.

When people's inner rejected shadows face the Light that bursts through you, they assume you to be a liar. Then they treat you like one. The fear is legitimate, but it's not an impasse.

You're showing to yourself in the dream how when you are "unaware", you subconsciously err on the side of courage, with an innocence and faith - you just found yourself in a line, walking to an asylum you're being guided to by an invisible hand. Faith and submission subconsciously.

And you ended up there, even as you think about escaping and delve in self-doubt.

It shows that on a subconscious level you're aligned well enough to take on your further phases up this ladder. This could be because of your spiritual practices in waking life.

Being in a line to the asylum means you've joined a certain vibrational frequency that some people are vibing at with you. You're never alone. This indicates the degree to which Christ Consciousness has invaded though you (and the world!). You recognize and appreciate that degree on a subconscious level.

The familiar girl you meet who sets you up, is an aspect of your Feminine psyche (probably "virgin" Feminine instincts of intuition, insight, acceptance etc) that you will rely on though this.

The keys and wallet you discover are the dimensions and assets you will discover emerging though you when you rely on these Feminine energies.

The boyfriend you miss (and how you miss him) demonstrates your current inner Masculine energies and how they're working with the inner Feminine. The Masculine Energies you carry are influenced by all the men who have ever influenced your life.

You're barefoot and half naked. Spiritual Ascension means you shed a lot of the Physical, the Maya, the Illusion that feeds your shadows. In most people, a "minimalist" lifestyle simply grows on them without them often even realizing. Broken phone means old modes of communication may not work as effectively. His response indicates you watch tik tok? 🙂

Social Media is always a tool that works for you or a weapon that works against you. What you choose to feed your conscious mind using this tool will determine how turbulent or smooth your ascension journey will be, as words cast spells whether read or spoken.

Barefoot is a pivotal symbol in dreams.

The Path to the Beloved is not paved with Roses alone but also Thorns. When the longing is Maddening enough, we walk barefoot, dazed, in a trance, to an "asylum" - a safe space to be mad in.

You're protected by forces beyond your knowledge and awareness. This access is there because you are consciously engaging in activities that are helping with your shadow-work.

Shadow-work is the workout that leads to ascension on the spiritual ladder. This entire journey is the journey of every single person - the journey of a Human to a Human Being - The Complete Human - Christ.

post_text: So I had a dream that I was driving without insurance and was hit on the driver side. I left the scene of the accident and still went to Mc.Donald’s. the girl in the car was a girl who didn’t like me from the past over a guy. she said she was completely hurt in the wreck. However when I got back to the scene she was gone and I seen my driver door returned to normal. We hired a private investigator.
comment_text:
This dream is telling you that you can heal part of you (driver door returning to normal) and dissipating some karma (you both were hurt, she was gone) by going back in your mind (returning to the scene). The dream says you hired the private investigator which could be the person you hire in real life to help you with the session - perhaps regression type?
Forgot to add, driving without insurance in other words when you were not fully protected and in dream s language that could refer to when you were a child /younger as we are not fully mature in our development.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for the add

post_text:
Warning…poop and fire.

This one woke me up crying.
I walk into my house, to numerous cat poops on the floor, but they are all on fire. (Orange flames) But instead of putting out the fire, I walk past. I realize that there are also cat toys on fire too. There are two kittens, but it seems that everything they touch is becoming enflamed. One of the cats bats a toy my way and suddenly it’s on fire. One of the cats is playing under a coffee table and the toy/carpet is on fire so much it singes her fur! I grab the cat and cry because she’s singed but it doesn’t seem hurt then. I tell the other person the cats are setting things on fire, as they seem unaware. They snap back at me and then me: “it’s YOUR cat setting everything on fire!!!”
I quickly realize that somehow they set a couch on fire, mainly the arm of the couch. The foam inside is smoldering. I run to get a bucket, but the first one is broken. The next one is full of dirty water, so I try and flush it down the toilet but it goes everywhere and the bucket proceeds to break too. I run to the kitchen to get a large cup just to slow the smoldering. But the water pressure is low and it’s taking forever. I fill the cup as much as I can and run to extinguish the fire. I keep going back for more water, and eventually find that the foam is smoldering near the floor, so I focus my attention there. Soon the foam reaches the floor/carpet and starts to set it on fire too. Now I’m aiming at the floor, as the smoldering has turned to actual fire. The floor becomes completely engulfed in flames and I can’t do anything except watch the flames crawl across the floor and up the wall. *wake up crying*
comment_text: Hi Tracey, I am wondering if emotionally you are feeling out of control. You could be feeling detached from something or even yourself. At the start of the dream you don’t seem to be in control but then later on in your dream you seem to wake up and take action but this then shows you could be feeling overwhelmed about something. You could also be feeling consumed by something, this could be with sadness which could result in a lack of motivation which was shown at the beginning. Your dream does seem to show you trying to heal and I think you need to give yourself time to be able to do this. At the start your cats are playing and want you to play with them, this could be showing the need to be able to let go of things and to focus on doing things where you can have fun instead of worrying about what others think.

post_text: I just had a dream about me and my ex/ god cuzzin we're in a hotel but I just came from getting a big bag of popcorn right. And we ran into these guys bad ones and one of the guys. Liked my god cuzzin accept of me right so my cuzzin had a whole another guy with the one of the other guys, gave her about 200 dollars to be with him when she had someone already there what was that all about I guess he liked her. So I ran up to the other guy trying to get me a couple of dollars to n I got a gun put on me and saying they we're going to kill me almost 🔫 whooped me and I ran too go my granny who died but I was running to her in the dream she was alive what does that mean?
comment_text: It may mean that you’re in a relationship because of money and feeling conflicted about it. Your granny may be representing wanting to talk to her because she could give you comfort and advice.
reply_text: Rita Catherine Yes indeed sorry 😐 I didn't respond earlier and thank u for helping I can give u feedback on it and I'm ready to talk too both of them

post_text: Had a dream the family and I were going to Disney in Florida, but we drove separately. Randomly while on my drive I see a man on a zero turn lawn mower off the side of the highway, I jump out and beat him up trying to take his lawn mower. When that doesn't work I leave. The next scene is me in jail, checking out the place everyone seems cool, a couple crazy people but we immediately get along like everyone is cool with me. Why did I dream this?
comment_text: Going to Disney Florida separately could mean you’re feeling left out in some way, not feeling any enjoyment. A lawn mower is slow moving and off to the side, so you may be feeling angry about how fast or slow moving something is taking. You’re feeling stuck and thinking about your relationships with people, and it seems good for the most part. But maybe you wish that something be different and then you wouldn’t feel the way you do.

post_text:
In the dream, I bought a house. I was in a different country, though I don’t know which ones. From the outside, it seemed tiny, dainty. Inside it was beautiful. Each floor was very small, painted lavender, and there were maybe about seven stories. Like my own personal tower. The rooms were full of furniture from the previous owner.

It started off amazing. Me, my mother (my mother lives in another country) and my best friend and her husband were cleaning the place out. I was keeping the furniture I did want, giving away others. One the rooms was a children’s room, with a small bed and a crib, both made of golden coloured metal. I gave the crib to my friend, as in my dream she was either newly pregnant or trying for a baby. As we were emptying that room, someone got a call that a local boy had been kicked out of his house by his awful father. We all knew of him. I told her to tell the kid he could stay here, in this room until he could go home or figure something out.

The boy never showed up in the dream, but somewhere around that conversation is when things started to go wrong.

My friend took a shower and saw someone looking at her from the drain. We checked every drain, and every drain in the house had someone looking through it. Like all you could see was the eyeball, looking up. The floorboards were suddenly rotten, they looked fine, but I’d step on them and they’d start to collapse down. I fell through the floor and into the basement of the house.

I contacted an insurance agent, and when I explained the issues he started to laugh, hysterically. Then that scene disappeared and suddenly I was someone else, a teen girl, trying desperately to pretend I went to a school I know I didn’t, trying to get this group of people to let me go somewhere with them. And not in the way of a teen just wanting to be included, they were doing something dangerous or bad and this girl, for some reason, needed to gain their trust, have them underestimate her, so she could find out what it was. It felt like her life depended on it. They ended up letting her tag along, but I woke up as soon as they started to walk away with her.

I don’t dream too often, and when I do they’re always so strange and I can never make sense of them, but this one left me a little freaked out.
comment_text:
The house represents you I think, and doing a self spring clean, going through changes.

The seven stories are particularly interesting if you know anything about the chakras...

I think the rejected boy being adopted represents integrating your own rejected masculine traits but in so doing creates personal chaos as the person you wete comfortable as starts to fall apart and deteriorate. I read it as you becoming uncomfortable as you go through these changes, perhaps feel you were not quite as great as you previously considered perhaps.

I think thats why you become a teemage girl, a period of time of self discovery, going through a new "coming of age" process.

post_text:
Really crazy night for me last night. 3 painful dreams / nightmares maybe :

1. My father got horrible rashes (scallops sized 4-5 acne on his face) and sick and not able to participate and enjoy during family festivities. I am somehow away from him and miss him and couple days later he posts on FB his rashes healed but he lost unhealthy amount of weight and wearing ugly clothes.

2. Trapped in driving my car when for some reason I can’t open my eyes and see anything and really hoping not to hit anything. Really trying hard to be able to open my eyes and putting lots of effort and finally able to open for few seconds before it closed off again. And those few seconds saw some cop cars in front of me not behind. Somehow I know I am on a narrow freeway and put lots of effort to be able to pull over. Then panicking what if I have hit a person and then they might have been hurt or died and I don’t know about it.

3. I am in home of some actress I don’t care about and they are leading a normal life. I am just there and it doesn’t make sense but they are not bothering me or interacting with me but I am somewhat comfy and exploring. Later someone in their home want to take their dogs on a walk 5-6 aggressive dogs and the dogs are on a leash but the person take a pair of scissors and cut off the leash. The dogs don’t attack me yet but I get scared and somehow able to escape to my car safely. That’s when I see my dad’s post on Facebook mentioned in dream #1
comment_text:
The dreams see to be about how uncomfortable you feel. Your father could be representing that you don’t feel self confident, and this isn’t a healthy situation; you’re not nourishing yourself.
You’re feeling trapped and don’t know what to do, can’t see the way forward. You need to pull over and find out what’s going on, think about what you’re doing and where you’re going.
The aggressive dogs could represent some criticisms that you are afraid of and want to retreat to safety. Maybe your car is safe because you can shut out everything there.

post_text:
I need some help here. Every night, I dream that I'm in a lake or something. I'm supposed to swim so I try, but I'm scared of what lies beneath me in the water. This is a recurring dream. Sometimes there's whales, other times I only feel stuff touching my legs and don't know what it is. There are also times that the water looks beautiful and I want to go in, but I'm scared.

Please help :)
comment_text: This dream invites you to enter into a deeper relationship with your emotions. You may be scared but take note of the whale. She can dive deep, her body is designed to cope with the changes and pressure. You can allways come up for air when you are ready. She is a metaphor encouraging you to do the same.

post_text:
My dreams have been interesting lately. I had a dream that I needed support on a project. Instead of ordering the customized necklaces with my husband and I photo, my brother in law wife order a real small pin. She put the pin on my t-shirt but it fell off because it was so tiny. Then I remember seeing this woman submit in verification of her marriage with photos to get inside the group for married people but in reality I’m inside this group as well for married people. I asked for her support and she got a small sized pin and started drawing on it instead of purchasing it. It was extremely small as well. I walked into the house and my husband grabbed me by the waist. He told me that I don’t need any friends.

The pins below are just example of pins due to them being the described pins

I had a weird dream about a man in a grocery store that was wearing this weird mask and if you looked at him he would hide behind something with a knife and try to stab the next person that walks by. But then when I looked at him he kinda tried to play mind games with me. It escalated and everyone (including myself) bolted for the front door. He followed behind everyone but this time has a gun. He specifically scoped out me and the people I was with because he walked past many others in the parking lot and didn’t once hurt them.
Then I woke myself up.
WHAR COULD THIS MEAN??
comment_text: Being in a grocery store can mean that you’re feeling unfulfilled in some way, there’s something you need. The mask can mean that you’ve been wearing a mask, maybe pretending that everything is ok. You’re avoiding dealing with this, so you’re having a dream to bring it to your attention.

post_text: So I have had about 4 dreams that the end of the world ends in the same way. I won’t describe the first 3 but it all ends with the world ending. The last dream that I had was the same thing but details are that I was at Walmart and they offered us to bunker down in their warehouse. It started with us being informed about the world ending. Everyone was panicking and buying everything. I told my husband that we may have better luck at the Walmart in Mexico (we live in Florida but I have family in Brownsville Texas.) so we crossed the border into Walmart and bought what we needed. Then I realized I forgot water for my kids. I have 2 type one diabetic kids so they need it. By the time we got back my kids where separated and I was worried about their insulin. I was stuck in the car with my husband because we got back after the time that the news announced of the world ending. The other 3 dreams were similar.
comment_text: This dream symbol of the world ending and everything around you going wrong means you feel hopeless and overwhelmed.
reply_text: Sheridan Rain I can honestly say that it’s correct. With having 2 type one diabetics and a toddler. I am definitely overwhelmed and hopeless. I love my kids but I am definitely feeling hopeless.’

post_text: I had an interesting dream , i am not into politics to make it clear ( remove post if needed). So in my dream was President Joe Biden trying to take over my car Lol and take off with it , can anyone tell me what it might mean? thanks
comment_text: It would depend upon what the symbol "Joe Biden" means to you. Your thoughts, feelings, opinions of him. Then you have to remember that people in our dreams often symbolize aspects of ourselves. So what part of you that is like Joe Biden in some way has recently taking control (take the wheel)? Does that remind you of a situation that happened recently? Sometimes other people in our dream do represent someone in our life, so it's also possible that Joe Biden symbolizes someone in your life that took control in some situation recently.

post_text: I had an interesting dream , i am not into politics to make it clear ( remove post if needed). So in my dream was President Joe Biden trying to take over my car Lol and take off with it , can anyone tell me what it might mean? thanks
comment_text: It means you feel helpless about situations involving government and laws. Usually when people dream about driving cars they have poor control over the car. That dream symbol is a feeling of lack of control over your life. The president taking your car represents feeling a lack of control over laws or government. Might not be that you didn't want him to win, but that you feel certain things government or authority controls has a negative impact on you or society.

So I have weird dreams quite often and they are usually very vivid.

Backstory I don’t know if this could be related to the dream so my son (toddler) has and random scratches on him could be from himself through the night we recently changed diapers due to saving money and we noticed during the day he would scratch his back area where the diaper was. he sometimes has scratches on his head or other places. We have changed back diapers now to see if the diaper was the problem he also has a form of eczema so he has itchy skin at times . I told my husband it freaks me out cause my mom brain over thinks and since he wakes up with them in the morning I think what if a ghost or something. My husband reassures me there is no ghost .

Anyways last night I had a dream and The dream was
I wake up and go to my son to get him out of his crib and he has scratches all over his tummy and back and I freak out send a video to my hubby .I go sit on the bed with him and I remember just being so scared in the room. We wind up at some hotel and it’s me and my sisters and hubby and we all just hanging out and I ask him if he has watched the video he hasn’t that he left his phone and I tell him about it and he doest take it serious so I try to leave and I’m in the parking lot and my car is next to another vehicle and it has a walker in between it I assume it was my great grandma because she used a walker ( she has recently passed )
I open the door slightly and turn the key and then go to passenger side to get in when I noticed my fiancé turn off the car and say your not leaving . Some more stuff happened the scene changed I was at my grandma house in the backyard and the fish was jumping out the water . I often dream about the pond of my grandparents backyard but I don’t think it has to much meaning in this dream . ￼

Honestly it could be me just overthinking so much that I’m having dreams about it but I hope he’s okay and if anyone can let me know if their is a meaning to this dream that would be great.
comment_text:
In my opinion all dreams have meaning, but being a symbolic message they can be really odd.

My suspicion is that the dream characters are symbols of aspects of yourself and not about those people external to you in waking.

In that context I'd see your child as either an inner child aspect or maybe, and I think given the scene with the car as a symbol of the personal journey this is how I would lean, that he is a symbol of your personal development (the new version if you that has come out of you).

Your partner I think is representing your intellect (masculine as thinking vs feminine as feeling). So I would see this as saying your innrr child or developing self has been attacked but you don't understand how or why, and are intellectually refusing to contemplate it.

And in that refusal you are as a result also refusing to continue your journey (not driving).

I think the walker might be tied to that too, like you have the option to engage your analytucal mind and figure what is causing this issue and resolve the problem at its root, or you can stop your personal growth journey, put up with the symptoms (walker as a support dealing with being in a disabled state).

Thats not the only way to look at these symbols though, just how I see the dream patterns.

Dreamed about watching baseball highlights on TV. It was the Angels vs Rangers. In the highlights they showed the Angels pitcher striking out the Rangers batter.

2nd dream

I was on the ferry sitting on the seat upstairs looking out the window and seeing people work on the dock repairing something.

Can anyone help interpret these dreams?
comment_text:
Showing that the angels have the upper hand in your life right now. This is the first dream.
The second dream is about you coming into a new place in life. The dock work is something being prepared for you. Your ship is coming in.
reply_text: Roy De Ruyter, Thank you for the interpretation.

post_text:

2nd dream

I was on the ferry sitting on the seat upstairs looking out the window and seeing people work on the dock repairing something.

comment_text:
Ferry is feeling stable in your relationSHIP, and heading somewhere in your relationship. Having a window of opportunity to repair the foundation to ferl grounded in your relationship 💜

Hope you and your family are well David Dhaliwal!
reply_text: Nina Kaye, Thank you for the interpretation.

post_text: I had a dream of my mother growing horns on her head. I currently don’t speak to her due to me cutting her off a couple months ago. Does it mean I see her in negative or evil aspect?
comment_text: I see it as a not-so-gentle reminder of why you cut her off.

post_text: I had a dream of my mother growing horns on her head. I currently don’t speak to her due to me cutting her off a couple months ago. Does it mean I see her in negative or evil aspect?
comment_text:
Hard to say, was there any more to the dream? Horns can certainly have links to evil, but it can link to nature; and in combination something you view as evil could be in her nature due to her own past experiences.

But then the mother figure could be representative of the divine feminine which you could argue has been demonised.

Its pretty complex. Lots to consider.

Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for the add

comment_text:
Not a trauma dream but rather the dream is revealing your own power (you may check spirit /power animal). Rather than fighting it, work towards the integration of this image as it is part of you. You can draw it out or simply observe the image of a tigress (you said it was her)
Tigers are often found in the dreams commenting on the career as well.
Are you afraid to step into your full power? (contemplate what would that mean for you)
Thank you for sharing your dream.🐅

post_text: I keep dreaming that a huge tiger is coming after me and my dog and cats and I am trying to fight and scare her off without harming her. Is this a trauma dream? Thank you 💚
comment_text: Hi Tracie, following on from Akva, I think I would probably be looking at some sort of confrontation, possibly linking up to your own insecurities. To me, to stand up to the tiger, you needed to face a fear but at the same time, you had to remain calm in order to protect your dog and cats. Therefore the part of you which represents your cats and dogs could be where you feel safe and secure, but the tiger is where you lack trust and understanding. Confronting the tiger, means you could be facing up this and controlling your fear of facing up to things.

post_text:
Rough drawing attached for reference below!

Last night I dreamt a typical, nondescript dream, but then my dream was interrupted. It quite literally felt like someone had hacked my brain with an extremely realistic and vivid video that was being broadcast; it almost felt like a subliminal message being flashed quickly. It was a dark forest at night as I faced a line of trees, presumably the edge of a forest. A metal sign hung from the middle tree in front of me that had the feeling of a No Tresspassing sign. Besides the illegible text at the top, there was an all-seeing eye right in the middle. Suddenly red and blue lights flashed behind it alternatively, like cop car lights, VIVIDLY and almost neon and overly saturated. Fog started rolling out behind the sign from the lights, and the “video” started zooming in slowly towards the sign while rotating. The focus was always on the sign. After that, I returned to my nondescript dream that I was in prior to that.

It very much felt like someone had hacked my dream to show me this scene, like an urgent message. It didn’t feel like I personally was there, rather that someone had filmed it objectively with the intention of sending it to me.

l somewhat understand the significance of the forest and the eye, but what I can’t wrap my head around, is the feeling that someone or something intervened in my dream to show me this bizarre image. It felt like it was warning me of something, neither good nor bad, just that it was urgent. I’ve never experienced this sensation of my dream being taken over like a breaking news broadcast before.
comment_text: Well they are talking about putting ads in dreams which is why I'm suddenly keen on lucid dreaming so I can click the skip ads box.
reply_text: Timothy Kippo I don't think that's what this was though 😂 it felt like someone who knows me was trying very hard to somehow tap my dream to make sure I saw this image. I'm still stuck with little to no information on it >.o

reply_text:
Timothy Kippo thank you! It was such a short burst of an image but I'll do my best to at least tell you what it felt like!

It felt like the line of trees going into the forest acted like a gate. I feel like I was supposed to be going inside, but that the metal plate with the eye on it was describing what was beyond. I feel like the lights flashing and mist were separate from the sign identifying what was beyond the trees. I think I was meant to go into the forest, like something was waiting for me beyond the sign that I needed to see or do. And the lights gave me this sense of "if you go in here things won't be the same, are you SURE you want to proceed?"

The lights felt disembodied, I don't think they were attached to anything like a cop car or ambulance, more like sentient lights.

One more thing I remember is towards the end, when the vision was zooming in towards the eye, the color of the lights started blending together and turning purple behind the eye.

I hope that helps 🙏

post_text:
Rough drawing attached for reference below!

Last night I dreamt a typical, nondescript dream, but then my dream was interrupted. It quite literally felt like someone had hacked my brain with an extremely realistic and vivid video that was being broadcast; it almost felt like a subliminal message being flashed quickly. It was a dark forest at night as I faced a line of trees, presumably the edge of a forest. A metal sign hung from the middle tree in front of me that had the feeling of a No Tresspassing sign. Besides the illegible text at the top, there was an all-seeing eye right in the middle. Suddenly red and blue lights flashed behind it alternatively, like cop car lights, VIVIDLY and almost neon and overly saturated. Fog started rolling out behind the sign from the lights, and the “video” started zooming in slowly towards the sign while rotating. The focus was always on the sign. After that, I returned to my nondescript dream that I was in prior to that.

It very much felt like someone had hacked my dream to show me this scene, like an urgent message. It didn’t feel like I personally was there, rather that someone had filmed it objectively with the intention of sending it to me.

l somewhat understand the significance of the forest and the eye, but what I can’t wrap my head around, is the feeling that someone or something intervened in my dream to show me this bizarre image. It felt like it was warning me of something, neither good nor bad, just that it was urgent. I’ve never experienced this sensation of my dream being taken over like a breaking news broadcast before.
comment_text: Seems like you were looking for some kind of answer to something you didn't know (the dark forest, foggy) and we're looking for a sign from your intuition. The sign could be referencing a "sign" and the eye seems to symbolize looking for clarity or third eye chakra, especially with the colors in the dream merging to purple, the color associated with the third eye chakra, the site of our psychic awareness.

post_text:
Hello, first post on this group, thank you for accepting me.
I had a dream this week that I was getting married to someone I didn’t know.
I could see guests arriving but they were all dressed in very casual clothing, where I was getting ready to put on my wedding dress which I never got to see, I woke up before the actual wedding.
Whilst getting ready I was very disappointed that a close friend hadn’t turned up for the wedding and was then hoping that my unknown groom wasn’t going to show.
I remember reading cards from guests congratulating me on getting married, it was only my name on the card.
It’s all very strange, can anyone hazard a guess?
comment_text:
I feel the dream is asking to make a commitment to your masculine/
thinking side at the moment because that is missing right now.

post_text:
Reoccurring dream help needed please and thanks! ￼

Topics: Dorm, pets, plane, family and packing ALL important belongings.

Hello I have been having a lot of dreams about college. I never went to a university or dorm of any sort.

Dream: packing up my dorm room trying to make sure I have all of my stuff because Once leave I can’t go back. In previous dreams I can never get everything packed to fit in my bags and take with me. last night I had family helping. my (divorced sense I was age 1) mom and dad helped. My dad drove out to wherever I was to put big things that wouldn’t fit on plane In his tiny car. My mom flew out to help. once we were ready to get on plane to head home my kids and cat showed up. I watched as they all buckled up and got ready for take off. But I was outside the window/door watching. I ended up missing the flight as it took off I was panicked. Not for me for my mom because she would be worried about me left alone in an unfamiliar place so late at night￼. I told her I’m ok I’ll catch the next one that was coming at 3 am. No biggie. ITS Ok! IM OK! is what I was yelling to her as the plane took off. The people in the airport looked worried for me till i said no I’m good I’m worried about her worrying. Then all the sudden I’m back in dorm room packing with my dad. He had helped take all the pictures of loved ones and special things down off the walls. We had almost everything packed up he was fitting my king size bed in his tiny car along with other large objects. I was just going to ride home with him I though why wait for the next plane. He said he was going to come back Monday and buy a pice of furniture I was leaving behind and even though I wanted the piece still I was like ok my loss his gain. He’s helping that’s what’s right I’ll find a new one. Then all the sudden he was gone and one of my kids was with me. we were packing anything else we could find before the next plane came. Odd thing here was we were packing purses and other to go bags into our bag to bring. Once I was on the plane my kid turned into one of my dogs and our other dog was outside the plane barking and now it was snowing. I looked out the window saw her and told the people not to take off. They opened the planes long back hatch like on a military plane to let her in and she came running up. I could feel the coldness coming from her. then i watched the snow melting once she sat next to me and I could feel the warmth of her snuggle. Then we were ready to take off but I told them I had to pee before the plane took off. The flight attendant was not happy bc I did the same thing last time before the plane almost took off. Turns out I had to pee for real so I got up and that was my dream.

Normally I can’t find my ticket or lose track of time is why I miss plane. I also never have helpers or get packed up as far as I did last night. The only thing that was holding me up from taking off this time was my bladder. The one time I did take off on the plane in the dream the windows were open and my pets were all stuffed in a crumbling cage bc they had to be in cages to be on the plane. This dream last night they were allowed on with leashes or without like
Mine that almost got left behind. I saw people get on with their dogs and they each had a dog leash on one red one blue. ￼

Thanks In advance for any input￼ and for sticking with me I know I have horrible spelling and grammar issues. 💟💡

comment_text: Hello, the dorm could be about independence as college is a time in life when you move away from the support of family to live on your own and make your own decisions. It can also be about some learning from life experiences that you were reflecting on.You have support of your parents in the dream but they can be representing your rational (dad) and emotional (mom) sides. You seem to be quite capable on your own and more worried about taking care of others than worried about yourself. Plane trips can represent life aspirations or spiritual journeys. With your daughter being almost left behind, left out in the cold and then feeling her warmth and having to pee it would seem you may have some feelings or worries about her growing independence that you dislike. She could also be representing an aspect of you and indicating that deep down you really do have some tentative feelings about your situation yet you seem to regain your center easily with the knowledge your family is there for you and you for them.
reply_text:
Lauren Wemmer I like that than you. The part with my daughter was weird in the dream though. it wasn’t her left out in the cold it was one of our pups. I could remember my daughter getting on the plane with my mom and sons. So All the sudden when she disappeared I wasn’t worried bc I knew she was safe with my mom and her brothers. The one left out in the cold was acutely one of my dogs.

Not to sound like an ass we have 5 pets and I love them all but she is definitely the naughtiest as in does dog things that suck. Like getting into garbages, food thief, chewing things up etc. dog kind things

What could this dream mean?

I had a dream that my husband was telling me that he couldn’t come home the way he was out here in these streets. In the dream the girl that caused problems in between us actually moved on in her life. He ended up playing this song https://youtu.be/xycPAo_ncnE

Could this mean something?
comment_text: The song is about a man who is still thinking of another woman, so maybe you feel he is still thinks about her and can’t give his heart to you completely.
reply_text:
Rita Catherine this is what the song is about>This song tells a story of a man with addiction, fear, low self worth, emotionally unavailable who meets a woman who loves him from her soul, no matter how many times he hurts her, she love him still. She loves him unconditionally
that sometimes her soul cry’s, then in a moment of soberity during a time when they are separated he is reflecting on that connection and he realizes that he will never find a love more true, his heart opens but not because of his love for her but because of her love for him. That’s why he say because her love won’t let me lose her. He tries and tries to say a final goodbye, yet he search’s for that connection in other ppl, other activities but his soul won’t allow him to find her spirit, her energy in any other place, so they take this rollercoaster ride, the leaving and coming back and he realizes hopefully it’s not to late and he tells her either face to face or at the gravesite.
