The other night I had a dream that my crush gave me a ring. I don’t know if it was an engagement ring or not but it was just on my finger. Like how Dorthy got those shoes lol. It was ugly. It was like a rock candy ring pop and it had this big glass looking thing over it that was engraved but I couldn’t see it. Someone pointed it out. It was either to show that I should have respect or that I’m taken or both. Then they asked if I was going to keep it cuz it was so weird. I wanted to keep it.

In real life he just broke up with his girlfriend and said he’s giving up. He knows I like him. I just want him to be happy no matter who he’s with.
comment_text: Since the ring is ugly, there might be some drawback that you are thinking of. Maybe it’s possible he’s not really giving up on her? Or you think what he has to offer won’t be very good for you, but you’ll take anything...but the engraving is reminding you to have respect...for yourself or for what he’s feeling? Maybe it’s too soon since he just broke up. Jessie Morgan

post_text:
So I woke up pretty anxious bc I had the craziest dream that felt like it lasted forever!
I remember going into a store and my mouth hurt and was swollen really bad and it looked like a huge white tooth was trying to come through my gums…I was in a store and couldn’t afford much so everyone who owned the store gave me all these nice things for free including (two white owls) that I was bringing home to take care of! Owls already scare me due to everyone in life telling me it’s bad luck to see owls…then on top of all that , my body felt like it was trying to wake up but my mind wouldn’t let me! Like sleep paralysis! Can anyone ease my mind and help me!?
comment_text: A tooth can be a symbol of power - white teeth a symbol of personal freedom. I believe that it may be time to stand up for yourself, stand in your power and speak your own truth. It might not be comfortable for you. When we are passive people and we try to be assertive, we feel like we are being aggressive. You can still be respectful of others and speak your truth. White owls in my experience mean some sort of change is coming that you were not expecting. I also view owls as messengers or bringers of intuitive insight, wisdom, a knowing of spiritual things. I think this is a wonderful dream. I think it shows that you are growing and opening up as a person. I hope that helps.

post_text:
Hello fellow dreamers. So I had this dream a few days ago and again last night. Same thing happened in both, but different people.

The dream started out in a familiar house. Nothing was strange or anything just the people in the dream and myself chatting and having a good time. After a little bit inside we go outside. Everyone is just sitting there chatting as I am spaced out looking at the moon. Then I turn and tell everyone we are no longer on earth. Everyone asks me what I mean and I point. The moon I was spaced out into was 3 moons. The sky was a light pastel purple/blue and I tell everyone we are on Jupiter. Nobody believes me and tells me it was all just a reflection. I woke up after someone kissed me.

That is all that I remember from the dream, but it’s been one of them dreams that constantly have been running in my awake life so I’m curious on what anything about it could mean especially since it’s been twice with different people in less then a week.
comment_text: The planet Jupiter represents expansion and everything going well. The sky colors are peaceful and spiritual. Maybe you need to believe that things are better than you think.
reply_text: Rita Catherine it’s been a theme in my life lately so maybe that’s accurate. Thank you

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for adding me!

post_text:
I am walking to a corner coffee shop.
Along the way, I see a beautiful historic home and walk up to the back door. I peek inside a window and am impressed with what I see. Like Goldilocks, I go in the house, uninvited.

It is quirky, wide plank wood floors, built in cabinets, shelves, nooks and crannies with all sorts of antique collectibles, fireplaces in every room. The kitchen has copper pots and pans hanging from a metal rack. The entire house is a showcase.

There are children’s books open and strewn all over the living room floor. A narrow, steep staircase that leads to the second floor. I go upstairs and explore a bit. In a drawer I see some colored pieces of metal that look kind of like skinny bullets.

I leave the house and pass a couple with their two children on my way to the coffee shop. While I’m there, they come back to announce that someone has been in their house and stolen something.

They approach me and accuse me, but I don’t remember taking anything. I reach into my pocket and there are two of the metal pegs, one green, one gold.

I am scolded, and worry that I’ll be arrested. But, the man gets some kind of device and tells me he wants to show me something. The device looks like a juicer. He places the gold peg into a hole in the top and it squeezes out into a small pillow shape of soft foam.

I try to leave while people are distracted, but just then, my real life employer (who happens to be the cook at the cafe) says that she found a note that I wrote. She reads it out loud.

It says something about not being sorry for my actions and that if I hadn’t gotten caught, no one would be the wiser.

Just then I wake up.
comment_text: Has anything happened at your work where you feel justified in what action you took?

post_text: Had the worst dream. Dreamed I moved into my cousins house, I can’t stand the oldest one she’s a dictator. I tried organizing my stuff in my other cousins room that I’ll be sharing and I just couldn’t. I had no space and their cat was eating my cats food (uncles allergic to cats so no cats) I was wondering why I had to give up living in my place and my mom said I had to rent it out for extra money. I heard some yelling outside the room and realized it was the cousin I can’t stand and was wondering if I could stay in the storage unit that I put all my furniture in.
comment_text:
You’re trying to organize and get stuff sorted out, but can’t do it. It’s an impossible situation that makes you want to put it in storage so you don’t have to deal with it.
Maybe your life seems unmanageable at this time.

post_text: I just had the shittiest dream. I was sitting with people from high school but older now and like I was in a bad mood where things kept irritating me and I kept feeling overly sensitive or jabbed at though everything was fine and I walked away like almost a gamtrum.. one.. because I wanted the attention, for them to chase to make sure I was okay but I don't even think I knew why I was upset.. I just felt like moody and couldn't help it and walked away twice.. and the next time I waslikeim sorry it's not you guys just trying to get myself out of a bad mood.. then in the next room this guy I knew forever, family friend who has severe anger mood issues was being nice and him and his mom were offering food, randomly tells me he doesn't feel well, they're trying to be almost overly nice.
comment_text: The dream may be reflecting that when you’re angry you aren’t able to express it and feel you have to act nice. You may be overly nice so nobody suspects how you really feel.

post_text: Hi guys I dreamed I was fishing …line got stuck and went down there was a shark and another attacking each other on the line and they kept coming I kept being pulled until I let go and went up what does it mean?
comment_text: Maybe there’s a situation involving people you know that are trying to involve you in their problem, and you should just let it go.

post_text:
I have this dream every year and I don't understand it...

It's a dream about my grandparents and I travel to my grandma's friends house. We get the house tour then my grandma and her friend leave, grandpa takes a nap and I'm stuck on the couch with only a recorded sports show that works and their cats near me. They never state they have a son that lives with them but I eventually enter the upstairs looking for someone to help me shut the show off and I find their son my age. We start talking and making out then we have sex til his mom catches us then he brings girls over and it flashes to me being a ghost stuck in the house watching him be with girl after girl while I'm stuck watching the same recorded episode and "petting" the cats and me scaring the girls he brings home. But it never shows why I'm a ghost.
comment_text: Being a ghost can mean that you feel people don’t see you for who you are, and nobody is listening to you. The boy could mean that you need to be more self confident. Petting the cats can mean you’re trying to soothe your feelings.

post_text:
I thought I'd share a beautiful dream I had last year...

I dreamed I was a man with a female friend. She showed me her greenhouse solarium with beautiful healthy green plants and glass structure. Then led me outside through an open doorway. It was nighttime and the whole sky was filled with bright stars.

She cast a spell to bring out to make the inner self, the animus and homunculus, visible. She and I thought the spell was for herself and didn't work. But illuminated white ghostly figures appeared to me above, calmly pacing the green grass above us, with the stars in that background.

The ghostly figures were of a woman in white with a peaceful male lion.

I didn't understand and for a minute was agitated asking does anyone else see? The woman and a quiet little small dark terrier who was there barely seen like a friendly shadow they could not see the white figures above.

The woman became calm, content, and knowing as her spell had worked. It showed the inner self of me instead of herself

The images of the peaceful woman in white with the peaceful lion were similar to the Strength card in tarot

And the terrier reminded me of the dog in the fool card, meaning to trust the devotion of your own small shadow intuition and instinct which protects you from harm as you try new adventures innocently
comment_text: Interesting dream. Reassurance about inner work working do you think? At first it doesnt seem to have any impact but there is something projected that is difficult to see, but once you see it, peace and contentment?
reply_text: Oh goodness, I forgot to describe the ghostly figures, I am going to edit the dream now Timothy Kippo

post_text: I had a dream that I was pregnant. I was 4 or 5 months pregnant in the dream. In the dream I was sleeping next to this blogger but she was really nosey. She was there to blog my business to others that wanted to know. My cousin was telling people that I was pregnant but calling me my first name that I tell people not to call me by. In the dream I was holding my son but still was pregnant. So I just got out the shower and etc. I wanted to bath my son but my son bathtub was in the sink instead. In the dream I felt so unprepared but I had my husband father, his help, auntie and everyone else help with our son. I mistakenly dropped my son on his head and his neck broke but come to find out that was a toy instead of my son. The blogger lady yelled at me saying that they are just crayons. I was shook because I was bathing him in the bath tub but the water was too high. my husband was saying his water was too hot for him. Let me remind you I was still pregnant but holding my son at the same time. Then I asked people for help finding my son. In the dream I was going crazy asking for people help looking for my son.
comment_text: I think it is something developing, that you ate being careful to do the right thing, but mistakes are made, its a learning experience maybe, even so you deeply care about results?
reply_text: Timothy Kippo Thanks so much

post_text: Hello new to this group!! But I think I’m going to love it! Why do I always dream of me having a baby? I’m not in a relationship.. I think I’m content with not having 1. But there’s always a newborn girl in my dreams and I’m pretty sure she’s mine. Also does anybody else always dream when they fall asleep? I woke up out my sleep 4 times and 4 times I either resumed the same dream or another one of my reoccurring dreams would start. I remember my dreams every night unless I’ve been drinking. Is that common? I will post more about them but if they are terrifying I literally tell myself this got to be a dream and wake myself up.
comment_text: Having a baby is about starting a new something in life. This dream has to do with your path.
reply_text: Roy De Ruyter I hope so… but this baby been popping up some time now lol. I need to be on that path!!!

post_text: Hello new to this group!! But I think I’m going to love it! Why do I always dream of me having a baby? I’m not in a relationship.. I think I’m content with not having 1. comment_text:
Its funny, had a few people asking if its normal to dream all the time. I used to say its not common, well, its not common to remember them. But maybe its more common than I thought.

I have dream series too. They're interesting, looking forward to seeing your posts.
reply_text: Timothy Kippo I was always told it’s uncommon too… that’s why I’m like what’s going on with my head at night lol. I can honestly say I enjoy them. (Sometimes lol) but even the bad dreams I feel have a meaning.

post_text:
First post! I posted an anonymous post, didn’t mean for it to be anonymous. It was just about how I started dreaming daily about 8 months ago which is wierd and freaky anyways:

Dream last night.

I was at my ex bfs house “we split in real life 1.5 years ago, I had to leave because of DV” so in my dream I was at his house but it was mine. I think I was in school had to study or something. My study buddies came over and they FLEW over 😂I thought it was so cool and this guy can’t remember a face, taught me how to fly. I started flying everywhere around the neighborhood!! I saw him do a flip, so I tried one but I immediately fell to the ground because I was to fat. He told me to fly better I had to lose some weight. I then proceeded to fly around. I flew to the neighbors and started swinging one arm on a tree and they where shocked I could fly. I told him I got the vaccine moderna shot and if he got it to he may also be able to fly 😂. Anyways now I’m back at home inside and there is a fight across the street and the guy has a gun. I had to hurry and get my mom, neice and someone else inside this car but it was like a clown car 😂😂. We all got in and I made them stay real quiet and I hurried it out the front door and down the street, it was so stressful. I woke after that.

In real time I woke at 5AM to a beeping in my ear like a car door for 5 seconds, that freaked me out and I started thinking I was hearing things so I didn’t go back to sleep till 6.

Then I went back to sleep for 2 hours, I just woke up BUt! For the first time in my dream something wierd happened. I was hanging with my brother, (prior to this part of my dream I was doing something but I can’t remember what I was doing.)we where In his van and I STARTED TELLING HIM ABOUT MY DREAM… from when before I woke at 5AM 😂 so crazy! Then I went on to someone breaking into my car and she stole my stuff, she was homeless and with other people but also lives in a sober house. She gave me back one pair of shoes and I finally got the other one from her after threatening her. I took the box home and they where diff shoes. I took them back to her and freaked out on her yelling. Her and her friends started looking for the shoe. It was taking forever; she got in my face and I told her to get out of my face or I would fight her. She didn’t so I punched her but it was a slow punch, I hit her face where her glasses where and didn’t think it hurt her but she said OWE and started crying. We where all of a sudden in her sober house and I was talking a bunch of smack to her and her friends calling them low life’s. Then I told them to go get a drug and alcohol assessment and I helped them with resources 😂 the girl that needed to find my shoe left to find my shoe in a golf cart full of her stuff. So I asked her roommate where her other stuff was and she showed me bexause I was going to take some of her stuff as collateral until she got me my shoe. But it was all baby stuff and I didn’t wanna take her baby stuff. All of a sudden I was on the roof my mom was there and someone else idk who and I thought I was to fat for the roof and I was going to break it. Then all of a sudden it was not my real mom but it was my street mom and she was nice and helped me and showed me where the girls food was. I messed up her cupboards and took some of her food. (I have clients in real life for my job) one of my clients I haven’t heard from was in my dream and I told her you neeed to call me you are not in compliance and she shut the door on me. I was irritated but I left and remember thinking in my dream about daily stuff it’s wierd. Anyways I walk outside and it’s like a beautiful Christmas wonderland and these 2 men said hello to me really nice but I felt like they where only nice bexause they wanted me to buy things from the venders at the park… it was snowing… then I woke up.

Sorry if that was a lot. I left a lot out.

comment_text:
The dream interpreter Carl Jung also coined the term synchronicities
. In my experience, and judging by the amount of people experiencing much the same thing on the internet, seeing repeating numbers, typically 11:11 or 22:22 is a particular type of synchronicity that can often mark the beginning of what some people call a spiritual awakening, an unconscious process.

In the weeks leading up to a spontaneous mystical experience I had a couple of years back I experienced a ton of synchronicities
/
meaningful coincidences, and at their height they took on religious symbolism, for me this was Christian symbolism, including references to Bible verses, even though I was not religious. Dreams, synchronicities, religious symbolism and experiences are all behaviors of the unconscious. Synchronicities
, imo, often indicate some transformation of the psyche is imminent, or the you ego consciousness is weak, as it is when you're still walking up. If the synchronicities
get really common in daily life if your unconscious overpowers your ego consciousness I'd start to suspect you might be heading towards a spiritual awakening, a mystical experience, or in rare cases psychosis.

I started seeing 22:22 a lot a few years back. I have a friend that used to wake in the night at 2:22 and get sleep paralysis regularly. She saw 222 so often she got it as a license plate. She also went through a spiritual awakening/
psychosis. The last time we visited the number cropped up everywhere.

post_text: I woke up at 2:22 am and wrote down revelations 14. Does anyone know what this is or what it means ?
comment_text:
222 is a synchronicity from a higher 5th or 6th dimension. When you see a reoccurring 3-4 number multiple times per day, write it down, you can look it up online for possible meanings (sometimes called angelic numbers), but you should take special note of what your consciousness was focusing on prior to seeing the number. Will increase as you are having a spiritual transition/
awakening. You'll get more info speaking with a shaman, psychic, or metaphysist regarding this.

post_text: I woke up at 2:22 am and wrote down revelations 14. Does anyone know what this is or what it means ?
comment_text:
Note that there is no Biblical book called “Revelations.” The book is called “Revelation” singular, because it identifies itself as one singular revelation. Lots of people refer to it by the wrong name, however, so you probably were having thoughts connecting to religion, myths, prophecy, the canon, etc.

Now, if you’ve never read Rev 14, then the contents of that chapter are going to be irrelevant to why you wrote this down.

Further, were you not awake? Don’t you remember writing it down? If the phrase “Revelations 14” is all we have to go on, we’re not going to be able to help you find meaning in the phrase.

Knowing that you’re not religious and haven’t read it helps, but we’ll need more detail about your dream, and in what context the phrase came up. Otherwise, we’ll just have to wait for the next one.

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

I have this dream every year and I don't understand it...

It's a dream about my grandparents and I travel to my grandma's friends house. We get the house tour then my grandma and her friend leave, grandpa takes a nap and I'm stuck on the couch with only a recorded sports show that works and their cats near me. They never state they have a son that lives with them but I eventually enter the upstairs looking for someone to help me shut the show off and I find their son my age. We start talking and making out then we have sex til his mom catches us then he brings girls over and it flashes to me being a ghost stuck in the house watching him be with girl after girl while I'm stuck watching the same recorded episode and "petting" the cats and me scaring the girls he brings home. But it never shows why I'm a ghost.
comment_text: To me this seems like you have been abandoned in some way. Left behind. Not given attention. You are a ghost because you are not visible to others. It is how you feel. Not seen. The sex with the boy is about how you are reaching out for connection and get dropped. He starts spending time with other girls and you are trying to get his attention is you looking for others to care about you. I see this dream as a sign that you should get professional help. This is a repeating theme that is best taken care of. It happens every year.
reply_text: Roy De Ruyter thank you

Dreamed about playing baseball with my P.E. Class. We played with a white rubber ball.
I was the right outfielder on my team.
I was playing without my baseball glove
I caught two high-fly balls in the same inning with my bare hands. After catching the ball I yelled “I caught it!!! I caught it!!! My teammates cheered after I caught the ball. After catching the ball the pitcher on my team pointed in the the direction to throw it at 1st base to get the runner out. Next inning I tried to catch a high fly ball but it bounced off the ground and over the fence for a ground rule double. I couldn’t climb over the fence. My teammate climbed the fence I got the ball. We didn’t let our opponent score in that inning. Next inning, one of their players tried to interfere with me. Then I woke up. Can anyone help interpret this dream?
comment_text: The dream might say that you enjoy teamwork and are proud of your abilities when it comes to working with others even though you might not be in a lead position (in the outfield). You recognize your important contribution. Not being able to go over the fence might indicate some boundaries you are unwilling or unable to cross in this work. You leave this up to others. Sometimes there's interference from whoever you view as the competition for your role.
reply_text: Lauren Wemmer, Thank you for the interpretation.

post_text: This is the second night I dreamt about elevators. What do elevators mean?
comment_text: An interesting concept to consider. Words that start with El. Many words in the English language that start with El are rooted in the concept of god specifically Elohim . Electricity, a source of power. Elevate, to make higher. Elect, to put in place of power. Elite, to be higher in status. Electron, the source of power behind electricity. Eloquent, to speak with persuasion. Elder, to be greater in age. And many more.
reply_text: Doug Matthews that’s interesting!

post_text:
Weird dream
I'm watching a football game on a large screen tv with my family.
My favorite football team is playing and about to run a trick play.
As the play starts, tornado sirens go off and there is all this confusion.
The camera guy is still focused on the player as the play is breaking down because of all the confusion.
He throws the ball to the ground and panics.
The camera then pans to the fans in the stands who are all just standing and watching this small funnel cloud go back and forth.
I keep scrolling at the TV "it's a tornado, dumbasses! Take cover!" While my kids are screaming in disbelief.
The crowd continues to stay in their seats until the funnel cloud strikes them causing a young couple to catch fire.
comment_text: This dream is how you are feeling about life at this time. The tornado represents a whirlwind going through your life. The fans in the stands just watching are others around you. The players on the field represents yourself in the game of life.
reply_text: Roy De Ruyter thank you

Hie ☺️...Today my dream was, l was walking with my brother at night. We had bought groceries, so we were walking on our way home.
I dropped my money $20usd from my hand then, after a few steps l discovered that there was no money in my hand. Then, l searched for it. There was a thief who stole it, so l picked $2. I recognised him & l didnt confront him instead, l started preaching to him the word of GOD-the 10 commandments though he was a not born again Christian & after that l left him.He seemed sorry but, l didnt ask my money back.

What does this mean???
comment_text: This dream is about another side to yourself. This side is the one who took the 20 dollars. You preached to him hoping he would listen. Not to be judgemental about yourself but to follow the truths of the commandments for yourself.

post_text:
Hi lovely people,
I had this dream in the night and remember the end clearly…

I was parking my car quickly as I was just dropping into a garage to ask something.

So reversing in but found myself not in a bay because somehow the lines were reflections from something , rather than drawn lines, which my car obscured so I pulled back out and reversed back into what was now a space.

A man was stood washing cars next to where I was as this was happening…

I had to also at the same time do a school drop off and met a family where the mum was carted around on a stretcher which was more like a ping pong table , but with felt fabric, in size and quite low to the ground.
She was cut in half by her hips. Sort of squashed rather than a clean cut.
There was no blood just brown marks and some missing body parts were spread about randomly on the stretcher.
She was naked but she looked like a mannequin.
Her husband and children were with her.

In waking life I am torn and my way forward is uncertain. I am trying to change my career path and work pattern and I worry about the future a little bit.

The school drops offs end this summer which is why I am able to do these changes in real life.

I do feel like the woman is I, but happy to hear other peoples feelings about this dream please.
comment_text: This dream does reflect your struggles at the moment. The woman who is in 2 pieces represents how you are feeling at this time. Torn about life. Parking the car is you taking a break from your path. You may be looking to change your purpose or path in life.

We continued walking and when we got close to town my SIL recognised an apartment building where her ex boyfriend lived. She wanted to go up and check on him, so we went up and knocked on his door. He opened it and was completely drunk. He started charging at me, and was becoming aggressive towards me. SIL tried to stop him but he was too drunk. I didn't understand why he was trying to attack he as I barely knew him. I ran out the apartment building as he tried to get me, but a guy sitting nearby came and rescued me. I noticed his bald head and big beard, and thought that it wasn't a style I liked on men but it didn't matter as he was helping me. My SIL took her ex back up to his apartment to try and settle him down. Then I woke up.
comment_text: To me in this dream you are being challenged in life. That you are with your sil represents traits she has are about yourself. This is about you struggling to move forward in life.

**Posting anonymously as it involves a pregnancy and nobody knows yet**

I'm not sure if this is the right group to ask but I will try anyway...

Years and years ago, when I was born a cousin in my family who was 3 at the time turned to her mom and told her out of the blue that I had just been born (exact day), I was a girl and she told her my name. (My name or gender wasn't known to anyone before my birth). Her mom told her that isn't true and I wasn't due yet (I was 4 weeks early).
My auntie later that day recieved a call from my dad who let her know i had been born that day and told them the gender and name (which my cousin had got correct). For years we have joked saying we have a psychic connection.

Last night, I had a dream that she came to my house and told me she was expecting a baby. I messaged her today telling her about my dream. I had the shock of my life today when she called me straight away and told me she is pregnant but hasn't let anyone know yet because she is only 8 weeks. She wasn't trying to conceive so I don't even know how this has come about in my mind whilst I was asleep.

Does anyone know of any information about this sort of stuff?

Thank you
comment_text: You do have a connection. Psychic connection is on the light side. It seems more connected than psychic. Soul connected maybe. This is connected to both your life paths.

I had a dream last night where I found myself with my family, with a sister that I don't know. Somehow accidently I hurt my sister and my father started applying bandages on her. Then I saw a rainstorm and just after that, a flood making water level as high, enough to cover up ground and 1st floor level. I saw a red car going to right if my house and starts struggling to get out the water (off course water already covered ground and 1st floor, no way to get our of water) and slowly starting submerging. However, the driver was able to open the car door and try to jump on one of the roof of the house whose tip was still not fully submerged, and he was successfull (car colour was red). As water level was rising and me and my family was still on 1st floor, I rushed in the rooms and try calling my father to come and go to upper level (my house has total ground, 1st, 2nd and 3rd level as a roof (accessible)) and I started collecting warm clothes, blanket with me to take to another level. But when I came out of the room, I saw water level gone down a bit (like 40%) and the current 1st level floor was safe and now there was no need to go to next level. Then, I saw the family and the guy (who successfully took out and jumped on the tip of other's house roof, mentioned earlier) in the balcony of same other's house.

Note: in real life, the other's house that I see and the house I was in are both real in real life. Others house is my neighbour s house. The family I saw is known and real except that girl that I hurt in the dream
comment_text: This house represents you and how your life is going. The water represents your emotions that you are going through. Rising and falling according to your own struggles. Going down 40% is a positive sign. This to me reflects your relationships with your father especially and other people. Maybe neighbor or acquaintances.

Nękø Nightfall this looks to me like Pippi Longstocking's horse, Old Man.

While she would ride the horse, she would also carry him, because she was extraordinarily
strong.

If you know this story, I wonder if it has any relevance as a symbol for your dream

Adopting a horse for your rescue for example, might be about how you are rediscovering your childlike sense of wonder and adventure and extraordinary strength, by "carrying" this horse - by taking care of an animal, that traditionally, is considered to be of service to humans for farming or carrying humans. Instead, you will be taking care of and tending this horse.

If the horse is "retired" then the name of Pippis horse "old man" might be relevant

Horse - (and Pippi!) - keyword I think of is strength.

Oh I just noticed paint markings were on your dream horse - yes, in Pippi, the spots were painted on lol I do seem to recall that...

To have spots painted on, in this rescue horse scenario might be that the "negative marks against this horse" are superficial and artificial. "Painted on" as in falsified, the "black marks" against adopting this animal are not truly valid.

Possibly also there is a saying of being "unable to change one's spots (or stripes)" meaning that we cannot change who we are, who we appear to be, cannot change our nature.

This horse, however, it seems like it CAN change it's spots lol it can change its nature

Spots can also be a pun, if for example when you adopt the animal you will change its location. It might be the feeling that if you adopt it and change it's location, the negative marks on it's character are going to change

Horse... strength, speed, power... being burdened or saddled with responsibility or work, can also be about freedom if unsaddled, if it has blinkers on it could be about blindspot you have.

A bridle can be a pun for a wedding, and commitment

Wild horse can be a free spirit
reply_text: Nina Kaye She is an old pony who has retired. Thank you so much 😊

My first sharing of a dream here🌷. I dreamt that I was in a small city, walking around, then suddenly a big horse runs in the streets. The horse run straight to a glass window head first, an begun to bleed heavily from his neck. I said to some friend "so sad he had to do that, now he's going to die". It was suprising to me that the horse did not die. I think it transformed to a human (man) who wasn't kind to others, and who others were afraid of- but I wasn't.
Thanks beforehand 💐
Edit. I don't have a horse and I don't ride.
comment_text: To me this horse represents sexuality, sexual power, stamina. When it changes into a man this is what determines that for me. That he is not nice represents a negative change in this area in some way. This may be part of your life experience in some way.
reply_text: Roy De Ruyter thank you so much 😊! The part that felt most important for me was the free, running horse crashing and then bleeding heavily - but he didn't die. I can relate that to your interpretation.

**TW**

Had a dream about my "father" who done some of the most disgusting things to me as a young child and is still alive, died of a heart attack, I was at the funeral in his dream but not at all grieving naturally, but his funeral was in the middle of a countryside and it was the brightest sunniest day I've ever seen. What does this mean?
comment_text:
To me, this dream means you're finally letting go of your traumas related to him. It means you're accepting them as your past, and yourself as someone who has survived them and grown through them.

Sending you Love.

post_text:
First of all, thanks for the add, which was a few weeks ago but I’m just finally getting to why I joined.
I usually can figure out my dreams pretty well, but for about almost 3 weeks straight, I had dreams of people. Just people. People with faces and bodies that I’ve never met. Each night was different, but with more people, more strange faces. I think Mercury was in my ruling planet of Neptune at the time. A lot of planetary and sun flare involvement too.
Most of the time I was just a witness, other times, I was saying something, but those parts I cannot remember.
My first impression was that it was people of Ukraine. Although I was watching the news on occasion, I made it a point to stay away from all forms of news just to see if my dreams would change. It didn’t help.
Now, years ago when a Tsunami hit Sri Lanka, I had dreamed of being on a beach and running to get a mom and child off because they were playing and not noticing the wave coming. We didn’t make if off but I was holding them and sort of flying. And there were many flocks of birds and we were all going in the same direction. When I woke up, my husband was reading the newspaper and tells me a tsunami hit …. I think my heart went to my feet and he saw my expression and got concerned. Yes, I believe I was there and helping people pass, but all I have is terms I’ve read, “Lightworker”.

This dream is not close to that, but seeing people, helping them is. I can’t help feel the confusion. The more I tried to stay in the dream and try to figure it out, the more I just kept repeating the same part.

Feelings?
comment_text: Could be that you are an empath and a healer. Hard to say from the dream but it seems you know that you clue into situations where healing is needed.
reply_text: Lauren Wemmer I am both… I think what puzzled me more is the constant same kind of dream with different people. Sometimes I was able to see a sort of shadow of me. Like I was standing off to the side, behind my upright shadow. Like a witness.

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.

comment_text:
I personally would prefer is members would make it their standard to add the following information for a better, more personal explanation.

Things like:

How did the dream make you feel?
(Happy,scared, annoyed, angry etc.)

In what scenery did the dream take place?
(Beach, woods, living room, on the streets etc.)

Mention special, outstanding details
(the color of a car, if the room had windows/doors or not, did the person have a face etc.)

Do u remember having a semi similar dream before? If so, when was it? & could you describe it, or at least mention any similarities you still remember. If you had more then 2 similar dreams, please list their similarities. Like they all had blue cars, or big fishes in them.
(This will indicate if this is a topic that has occupied the dreamer for a longer time. Especially if the dreamer has had multiple dreams with big fish in them, in combination with how the dreams made them feel, is very telling!!!)

I am probably forgetting alot more, however at this moment i think this would be my last request:

A little bit of their back story/current life situation.
(Like in a relationship/
single, religious or not, going to school/working/
unemployed, kids/pets or not, etc. If they dont want to disclose i completely understand however it is very significant for dreams. Like if you dream you are getting married but in fact dont even have a partner, its very different from when you do. Same goes for kids, dream of giving birth when in fact you arent pregnant nor have you ever been, is very different from someone who had 3 kids with a fourth on its way. And if you dream about being or going to school alot, but you haven't been in school for over 20 years, it means something completely different then for someone who is just starting collage... well i think u catch my drift... )

(HOWEVER i need to add one more thing in regards to religion.... put thats more of an opinion then anything else.... to each his own& i honestly respect everyones beliefs, religion & traditions... However it does bother me sometimes that some members plant seeds of panic, in an already panicked member by saying demons are coming for them and they need to pray. Stuff like that.... like, in what way is that a dream explanation?? If they would atleast explain why they state these things... but no. Without any explanation they post under many nightmare posts, to pray, go to church, call the priest, burn sage etc. Like yo i am willing to do all for you, ill ask the pope himself to cleanse your home if it was demon invested... but yooo these "demons" in your dreams, arent real demons, they are symbolic for something, like struggling with your inner demons...
Ok so i needed to get this off my chest, because this is just installing unnecessary fear in people. And it has nothing to do with the actual meaning of a dream.... Dreams contain real important messages for what happends within for us to be unraveled, we dont need prayers but serious dream volunteers to unraffle them. )

(We need priests, prayers, sage, lucky charms & the police or ghost busters to protect us. Lets give them a break and not involve them in dream descriptions.)
reply_text: Elisah Meis I agree but we've noticed many of our dreamers arent always English proficient because its not their primary language so sometimes we have to work with it

post_text:
Ok last night I had a strange dream. i was downstairs watching tele with my daughter (baby) and suddenly at the back of tele, a fire starts and it spreads quickly. I grab my daughter but bang my leg on the cabinet as I turn and then I go to run out the house. As I’m running out the house with my daughter in my arms, I call the dog and dog runs out with us and the fire also quickly follows behind us.
I’m assuming we was only ones in the house as I didn’t see my other children or my mother/brother who we also live with.
I try to call 999 but I keep calling 969 instead by accident. My neighbour appears at their door and runs in to get their phone.
I very abruptly wake up from this dream and my face is boiling like I’ve really just been there and I have a injury on the leg that I injured in my dream.
What on earth does this dream mean?
comment_text: If you were having a hot flush in your sleep, it could translate to a dream about fire or anger (spoken from experience when I had rosacea) but your face feeling hot could also be a result of the dream. Fire in dreams can represent anger. In this case perhaps something you observed caused it. You had problems communicating about it. Injuring your leg might mean you get your ability to move on from it was compromised.

post_text: I went to an appt complex hallway and knocked on someone’s door; I’m pretty sure it was a guy I knew while I was younger who gave me the middle finger as he drove by in a truck in a recent dream. I was talking to him then something he said made me ask him, “what did you do?” I remember feeling like he was talking about me, but he tried to hide it. Then I realized the apartment complex is in poor condition, inside the apartment looks like a messy hoarder situation, and then I noticed several feral cats. I should’ve tried to help get the guy out, but I was primarily concerned about my safety, so I was cautiously trying to walk towards either the front door or back door (whatever felt safer). I woke up before I left because my brain doesn’t let me get harmed, and I woke up with a panic attack or at least anxiety. I do feel like I know who the person was, but I want to mention that I rarely ever know or feel any connection with anyone in my dreams (it’s usually like people are around, but they don’t feel real). I can’t accurately say if I’m right about who it is or any feelings associated with the person because I had to calm myself down and remind myself that I’m protected.
comment_text:
Apartments in dreams can be like a mindset of your that you view as not really authentically you, like you don't take full ownership of it. The guy can be representing something you did (you asking him "what did you do?" ) and so the interior of the apartment is a reflection of how you feel about whatever that was. Hence you feel you are kind of a mess and the feral cats might be some cattiness that felt out of control or unlike you. Cats can also represent female sexuality, introversion or intuition among other things. The fact they are feral in the dream suggests you were judging yourself for not attending to them and letting your more animalistic urges run free. Basically, I think you woke up with anxiety because there was some situation in your life that you think you should have behaved differently but we are often our harshest critics so perhaps the dream is indicating to give yourself the compassion/
help you thought you should show the guy in the dream. This is how I read the dream but there can be many interpretations
so if this doesn't resonate look for others' responses.

post_text:
I keep on having recurring dreams about my parrots,
That I'm at my old family house (my family house as a child prior to my mom's passing)
They will be in my old room, and I'll come back to find my one parrot literally ripped into pieces/killed by something.. it's extremely disturbing..
Any thoughts regarding meaning? Cause I have no idea.
comment_text: Parrots can symbolize sociality or some say gossipping because they mimic what they hear. This dream could be symbolizing something innocuous like your feeling an urge to gossip is childish and so the parrot is killed in the dream as you kill the urge to talk about others. It might be recurring as you might be in situations a lot where others are engaging in talking about others. That's one interpretation but I can see other possibilities.

post_text:
I've got a fun/kinda sweet one for ya..
Real life context: I'm married to one man and am pregnant with our second child

I had a dream that I was in a throuple with a model looking man(his name was Ezekiel) and a fluffier man. The man was more Ezekiel's partner than mine.
They were both doting on me and taking care of everything I needed. It was so comforting. I felt very loved.
comment_text: Sounds like a wonderful dream and like you know the feeling of angels watching over you.

post_text: My son woke up crying saying he dreamt that I vanished and no longer existed.. and some people were going to take him home.. he can't tell me anymore details
comment_text: When a child has anxiety or fears in waking life....dreams are created while they sleep to symbolize fear/anxiety. You vanishing is simply a symbol for fear. Skie Sarfaraz

post_text: My son woke up crying saying he dreamt that I vanished and no longer existed.. and some people were going to take him home.. he can't tell me anymore details
comment_text:
Terry has a powerful point. To explore the fear it is a "fear of abandonment" and a worry also about belonging and stability.

You had mentioned Skie Sarfaraz that in previous dreams your husband has been ill. It might be that in this time of family illness, and the focus on illness and death and absence generally in the pandemic, your son is having a fear of loss or abandonment, a feeling of instability or lack of belonging. I think many people are feeling this way in general at this time, in the pandemic isolation.

At the same time, the pandemic has given us "separation anxiety" from the few people that we do see on a daily basis - if the social group we see has shrunk, there is even more pressure on those relationships, we can get "clingy"

The people who are going to take him home is both a part of the fear and also the antidote to the fear. The idea is that he has the concept that even if he has to face loss, he will not actually be alone, he will always be loved and cared for. However, there may be anxiety about how will he form a close bond with those others to feel stability and sense of belonging.

The idea though that they were "taking him home" is a truly positive antidote of a healthy inner person.

Your son is able to understand that he has a core feeling of safety and comfort, "feeling at home with himself" that IS constant, no matter who else is with him.

There are different things like mindfulness, meditation, and often actually in martial arts can bring this sense of a calm centre. That could strengthen this in your son, it can help to handle difficult life uncertainties of this time period with resiliency.

Also though, look at finding ways to fuel the bond of intimacy with you and your son over the next little bit to try to answer these fears. To read a special book to him at night to go to sleep perhaps, or to rub his back as he falls asleep, or to sing to him as he falls asleep.

It might be that if there is a lot that is calling on your stress or attention, that he is feelong a sense of "distance" from you which is not intentional on your part, but likely just a lack of "being in the moment" with focus on him, if there is other things calling on your attention or mood.

To try to look up this issue you can do a search of "separation anxiety"; "fear of abandonment" and likely the key one is "anxious attachment in children" and see if that gives you any ideas about your son...

💙 hope these ideas help! They are just ideas, if it isn't helpful, please discard them

post_text: My son woke up crying saying he dreamt that I vanished and no longer existed.. and some people were going to take him home.. he can't tell me anymore details
comment_text:
Skie Sarfaraz I have no knowledge of this clinic, I am in no way associated them or recommending them or this site overall. However this list about how to build resiliency in children is I think incredibly useful.

The list in this article is to build a feeling of
"competence, confidence, connection, character, contribution, coping and control."
https://
cbtprofessionals
.com.au/
the-7-cs-of-resi
lience/

post_text: My son woke up crying saying he dreamt that I vanished and no longer existed.. and some people were going to take him home.. he can't tell me anymore details
comment_text: Death in dream means growth

post_text: My son woke up crying saying he dreamt that I vanished and no longer existed.. and some people were going to take him home.. he can't tell me anymore details
comment_text: How old is your son? When kids learn about death, it can trigger these fear of loss dreams. Very natural. I still remember nightmare I had about losing my mom when I was a young child and began to understand our mortality.

post_text: i had a dream about a tsunami. i was in my old bedroom upstairs and i saw the tsunami, it broke my windows. i went to my moms room scared to tell her and she went to try and fix it but then it happened again. i ended up at my boyfriends house for some reason, to tell him something, but i had to go back to my house real quick and i realized that i couldn’t cus it could be dangerous i might get washed up. that’s when i woke up. what could this mean?
comment_text: Looking at the house as representing you, water as I'm guessing emotion, windows as your outlook on life, I see this as waves of emotion impacting how you are observing things, making it difficult to see clearly, perhaps in relation to your relationship?

post_text: Really strange I keep having these reacurring dreams that specifically my son is being kid napped and now he’s started to have dreams of something wrapping around him , he’s 4! what could this mean!?
comment_text: He’s probably is having dreams of another life it could be very possible that is reincarnated into someone else I’m not saying it true but some times it happens

post_text: My boyfriend of 3 years passed away this past January. I constantly have nightmares now. One dream that sticks out to me is after he passed away I had a dream he was in the hospital he passed in. I had got the news he was gone. post_text: So I had a dream I was in the passenger seat of a car going up a road like this, like 95% vertical climb, I woke up when we reached the top. Any suggestions what it might mean?????
comment_text: Aram Sarian the dream in my opinion is about overcoming an obstacle thats currently in your life.

post_text: So I had a dream I was in the passenger seat of a car going up a road like this, like 95% vertical climb, I woke up when we reached the top. Any suggestions what it might mean?????
comment_text:
Adding to Terry Dey that allowing yourself to "go with the flow" "enjoy the ride" "be carried along by someone else's energy" is going to help you to overcome this obstacle.

If you are also the driver, as some dream interpretations
suggest, it is your intense focus and drive that will get you over obstacle, but it has to paired with a go with the flow attitude as well, this balance will do it.

Otherwise, it is someone in your life that you are offering counterpoint to - their intense drive, and your going with the flow, this is having success against all odds.

I think of also the idea of a "steep incline"

Inclination - can mean a desire or character habit. Is there something that you are VERY much not normally inclined to do (you are only 5% inclined to do this) and yet you are having success because of your intense drive to do it, paired with your going with the flow, possibly allowing others to take the main lead?

Hope you are well Aram Sarian your dreams are often lovely in their spiritually resonant symbolic nature

post_text: So I had a dream I was in the passenger seat of a car going up a road like this, like 95% vertical climb, I woke up when we reached the top. Any suggestions what it might mean?????

Other think I think of is the desire or need "to ramp things up" meaning a sudden increase in activity or production as in the phrase "they ramped up production to meet with increased consumer demands for the product"

It makes me think of a project you might feel is about to take off, perhaps you are being "onboarded onto this project"

A "vertical climb" is a reference to climbing a mountain, which can be a sign of arduous work to reach an intimidating achievement. "Climb to new heights" can be accomplishment.
Going straight up this way... it gived me a sense of a spiritual dimension. To not only denote success or advancement, but that it aligns with spiritual growth of aspiring to live in accordance with personal values in your achievements

post_text:
Posting anonymous for protection.
I was sexually abused by my uncle back in 2011 he served time in prison and was released by 2015. Never heard from him since, neither has anyone in the family. Not had a bad dream or flashback etc since then either.
Last night I woke suddenly at around 3:30 from a horrible dream.
I had my cousin round (uncles daughter) my home and what I believe must be her new boyfriend. I knew it was a male that was with her but didn’t see his face. Then there was a knock at the door so I’ve gone to open it and a older man has barged past me and gone straight into my front room. I’ve followed to 1- see who they are and 2- see what on earth there doing.
It’s my uncle who abused me going to talk to his daughter, he was shouting a lot but I couldn’t understand what about. He was trying to get her to leave with him but she started crying and ran out the house and the male ran out after her. This left me and my uncle alone. He started having ago at me and how I sent him down after he begged me not to and that he would of just left and not spoke to me again. I tried to get run out and got to the hallway but he grabbed me by my arm and pushed me into my bedroom. He pushed me onto the bed and then he had a saw just waving it about. He was muttering and pacing back and forth in front of the door. There was a bang by the front door opening and then a gun shot and then I woke up.
Can someone try and figure this out for me please as it’s really triggered me and I’ve spent the past few hours googling what it means but failing.
comment_text:
The house as consciousness, I'm wondering if something has happened to soneone else that has made your past experiences intrude into your conscious awareness?

I'm not sure, but the saw seems significant, maybe this experience, symbolised by him, is threatening or in the act of immobilising you (thrown to bed and assuming the saw as neing to remove limbs, limbs being symbols of takung action). It could also be a play on words linking to what you "saw"?

The daughter could be a symbol for someone who can "relate" to this experience hence may not be a family member? In fact she could even be a symbol of part of your character, perhaps unwanted or aggressive advances being shot down because of your past experiences? Not necessarily forced but even just moving too fast as dreams can exagerate?

Keep in mind these are just some ideas of top of my head and may not resonate, could certainly be seen in different ways.

post_text:
Hi, I’m just wondering if somebody could interpret this dream for me. (I’d like to also add that I’ve never left the country or gone to USA and i have never spoken to this lady)

I dreamt of going to the USA to visit this lady off a page I follow. I don’t know how I got there because I didn’t have a passport, and mind me I’d just woken up and I was there. I remember having a coronary about the fact that my mum would freak If she knew I was in a completely different country.

But anyway, I was there with this lady and we’re chatting (I can’t remember what we were talking about though). After that I was back at this place I was supposed to be staying at and I remember talking to the people who were in the house. I was saying that I don’t know how I got there without a passport and not sure how I’ll get back either. Then a lady replied with I don’t care then all of a sudden a memory appeared in my head of being at the airport but they hadn’t even asked for my passport and let me through.

I don’t remember how but all this stuff we have here was at this place I was staying at and I saw these two cats that looked exactly like mine. I was worried that they were my cats and how I was gonna take them back along with this Ute and all the rest of it.

So In the next part of this dream I was with the lady again and we were travelling back via MK II Oppressors (futuristic bike that can hover and fly). We travelled back through some mountains and remember seeing these people and all this secret stuff happening. We hid so they couldn’t see us and when they left I noticed diamonds. After that we continued on our trip back to Australia and that was it.
comment_text: Can anybody please interpret this dream for me?

Uncertainty about how to get back to a proper or true identity, or at least where you feel you belong?

A lot like Dorothy and the wizard of Oz story actually.

post_text:
So I had this dream today about old friends (BFFs) in the village I used to live in Mexico when I was a teenager.

I was there for vacations, in my old house (now sold in real life because the area it was in became too polluted). But my house was also my high-school (which were nowhere near in real life). And I was hiding in my mother's room because I was depressed and wanted nothing to do with school. But I was still a teenager and my partners were still at school. Except my best friend Johnpi, who joined me in my mother's room to investigate... a murder. He needed a calm place to do that, so he skipped school. And he appreciated my help. He asked our classroom's nerd (who wasn't actually the classroom nerd in real-life) to give us copy in the math homework and she agreed. The whole classroom was very supportive of our endeavour, unlike in real-life. To skip gym class, the guys pretended to fall and get hurt to keep the teacher busy so she would not notice our absense. Oh, and this teacher was both the math and the gym teacher, in real life she was a literature teacher I had in university.

Fast-forwards, my mother complained I didn't go out enough, and that I should. I was depressed and didn't want to go anywhere, but said I would go out if my other best friend Angel agreed to meet with me. So I called him, told him I was in town, and asked if he would like to meet. He very excitingly accepted. "Great! Should I bring something?" I asked, excited too now, wondering if I should bring my Switch so we could play Pokemon.

Then I woke up. I neither solved the murder nor got to see Angel. But I still had a happy feeling.
comment_text: I wonder if this is in relation to avoiding some lesson from your past (hiding from the teacher in school)? Perhaps in relation to something related to social interactions? Maybe around reciprocated feelings and others mirroring your feelings and vice versa, and that in relation to feelings of isolation?
reply_text: (Sorry, I didn't see your answer) I think it might have something to do with me being so asocial. It's something that had been on my mind the days prior to the dream.

post_text:
Hi, thank you for the add!

A little backstory. I take care of my little brother, but we have been having a lot of behavioral issues with him at home and school, he also does not respect me or my husband.

Last night I had a dream, and we were at the house and decided we needed to go to the store for a couple things, I caught my brother leaving the door unlocked so I told him and my mom to go ahead of me and I locked everything behind me. We go to the store get what we need and head outside, my mother and I saw something we wanted and told my brother to go get in the car. We came out 2 minutes after him and I put the stuff in the car look in the back seat and the door is open but he is gone. I begin to freak out and we start to drive around while trying to call the cops when he comes out of no where all beat up. We begin to drive him to the hospital when he tells me it’s cause the house was locked and the robbers couldn’t get in. I felt panicked and upset.
comment_text:
Its interesting that he got beat up because the house was locked. That seems key to the dream and might help the meaning click.

The real question Im not sure about is whether brother represents your brother or, if in the dream he represents a part of you...

Also locking the house I think might actually about being/feeling secure, so maybe it is pointing towards where being secure is actually creating some negative consequence?
reply_text: Timothy Kippo hmm I could see that but I can’t pinpoint where I’m being extra careful about anything or recently trying to secure something. I am pregnant and having a baby soon so I’m not sure if that has anything to do with it.

post_text: I had a dream about my silly brother in law y’all. I had a dream he married his wife twice but he actually didn’t marry her twice at all. He actually married what it looked like someone else to me instead of her. This is his second marriage. He was jogging on the highway and I heard him calling someone name in the projects across the highway. Him and his wife got married in the backyard. He got in the car and left to speak with the older lady in the projects. My brother in law said that he wouldn’t dare marry his wife again if he had a choice.
comment_text:
I wonder if this coukd be symbolizing your own marriage. Maybe your not the same person you were when you married, and your beginning to recognise that.

Getting married twice suggests there is some new stage of commitment to each other. The marriage taking place in the backyard i feel means its of low importance or kept private somehow.

Jogging on the highway towards the projects, maybe you feel your husband has other projects that take him away from the marriage somehow, work or hobbies that he is involved with.

I wonder if you feel your husband feels differently about you.

I vould be on the wrong track here, these ideas are just one way to look at the symbols. Others might have an alternative viewpoint to offer. Sent with kind intentions for your consideration.
reply_text: Alexandra Moulding thanks so much and this is true because he’s gone right now. We did get married twice though but his brother got married twice but two marriages to different people. He’s gone right now on a project.

I wonder if you feel your husband feels differently about you.

I vould be on the wrong track here, these ideas are just one way to look at the symbols. Others might have an alternative viewpoint to offer. Sent with kind intentions for your consideration.
reply_text: Alexandra Moulding I forgot to add that yes I am a changed person from the first time in marriage. I’m a much better person

post_text: I dreamt last night that the world was literally coming to an end and that the president (who was Obama in my dream) had set a detonator in the core of the Earth for it to explode at 7AM because the Earth was just in such bad shape it wasn't worth saving. I was crying horribly and holding on to my animals. No idea why my loved ones (husband and kids) weren't included in the dream. I also was feeling really upset that my hibiscus was going to die also.
comment_text:
I could see this being relevant in respect to the perception of the outer world, but it could be more abour what is going on within; specifically in relation to your inner decision maker sabotaging/
demolishing a situation because its failing/seems hopeless?

post_text:
Hello and welcome to the group!

I hope you enjoy and get value from it. This is a group for people interested in dreams but we are generally not professionals or doing this for money, rather for entertainment/self exploration purposes only.

Our interpreters (anyone can interpret) are volunteers and not paid or dedicated to spending all their time here, so please treat them with respect even if what they say doesn't resonate - likewise when interpreting it helps to frame the interpretation as your opinion as opposed to instructing on what the dream means.

If you don't receive a response it is nothing personal, just bad timing. You can post a comment to bump your dream to the top of the feed. I have asked Facebook for a no response filter but so far that hasn't happened, would make things a lot easier!

Please also observe the following recommendations:

Please do not contact interpreters by PM unless they give you permission to do so.

A PM can only be requested by a dreamer - if you are asking Dreamer's to contact you, you will be removed from the group.

Do not use this group to self promote.

Please post more than just a single dream symbol (eg don't just say "I dreamt of a white snake whats it mean?"). Share the whole dream.
comment_text: Thanks for accepting my request. I have many dreams i need help understanding and.I have hope that I will get that help here with you all.
